category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids
title: Lower Monumental JFF Fire Protection Upgrade
description: Lower Monumental Juvenile Fish Facility Fire Protection Upgrade Sources Sought Notice: W912EF-22-R-SS20 The US Army Corps of Engineers, Walla Walla District is seeking sources for a construction project titled: Lower Monumental Juvenile Fish Facility Fire Protection Upgrade. The work is located in Walla Walla County, Washington. This will be a firm-fixed-price construction contract. Construction magnitude is estimated to be between $100,000 and $250,000. Performance and Payment bonds will be required. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this project is 238220 ? Fire sprinkler system installation, and the associated small business size standard is $16,500,000. This sources-sought announcement is a tool to identify interested businesses with the technical experience and capability to accomplish this work. This is not a solicitation. Only those firms who respond to this announcement by submitting the following information will be used in determining whether to set aside this requirement. Please do not respond to this notice unless you intend to respond to the solicitation. A.) Provide a capability statement expressing interest in this requirement, a list of no more than five current or past projects demonstrating technical experience with work of a similar nature to that listed in the Summary of Scope of Work. For each project submitted, provide a brief narrative statement of the work involved, your firm's role in the project, the dollar value and the completion date. Include a statement detailing any special qualifications and certifications, applicable to the scope of this project, held by your firm and/or in-house personnel. B.) A list of references for each of the projects submitted in A.) above. Include the point of contact, title, phone number and email address. C.) Provide a statement of your firm's business size (HUBZone, Service Disabled Veteran Owned, 8(a), small disadvantaged, or women-owned) with regards to the NAICS code listed above. D.) Provide a statement that your firm intends to submit an offer on the project when it is advertised. E.) Provide a statement of your firm's bonding capacity. A statement from your surety is NOT required. F.) Cage Code and UEI number. Submit this information to Nathan.i.bruce@usace.army.mil, Contract Specialist, via email. Your response to this notice must be received on or before 10:00 AM Pacific Time on April 28, 2022. Summary of Scope of Work: Lower Monumental Project (LMA) is located on the Snake River at mile 41.6.? The project includes a dam, powerhouse, navigation lock, two fish ladders, and a juvenile fish facility (JFF).? The overall purpose of the JFF is to improve juvenile fish survival with the goal of improving adult fish returns when the juveniles return from the ocean several years later.? The JFF contains a sampling lab, repair shop, and offices to maintain the facility as well as two dorm rooms to support overnight stays for the fish barge hands and JFF maintenance workers.?This project will resolve life safety deficiencies within the JFF by installing a wet pipe sprinkler system. Major items include the pipe system and fittings, standard fire protection devices (e.g. smoke alarms, strobe and horn devices, fire smoke dampers, fire control panel, et cetera). Electrical conduit and wire will need to be laid specifically for the fire system, since fire systems cannot share conduit with other systems.? Work is estimated to be completed by March 2023.

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) Moses Lake ATCT HVAC Controls Upgrade
description: Amendment 01: Posted April 22, 2022 ************Site Visit Time********** 4/14/22 Site visit start time chnaged to 1PM. Date is still Monday April 18, 2022 *********Clarification***********4/12/2022 Site Visit Date: Should be Monday April 18th.  ******Clarifications^^^^^^^ 4/5/2022 1) Due date is May 6, 2022 not May 13. A revised SF-1442 will be released as soon as I am able to. 2) Estimated start should be July 2022. This document defines the requirements to design and construct a new Building Automation System (BAS) for the Moses Lake, Washington Air Traffic Control Tower (MWH) and Base Building located at 7820 Andrews St NE Moses Lake, WA 98837. All existing controls equipment should be demolished and replaced with a new system, including the replacement of all control dampers. The new system should have the capacity to control and monitor the status of each of the roof top units (RTUs) and be able to control and monitor the temperature in each of the zones being served by the RTUs. The upgraded system shall utilize BACnet as the communications protocol and all new equipment should be BACnet compatible. Precision air conditioning (PAC) units in link and on intermediate floors should be tied into the new control system.

The project will require the contractor to remove existing tanks, pour new concrete slab, remove small tree and provide and install new propane tanks.?The Contractor shall provide all labor, materials, and equipment, as required, to accomplish the work.

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids
title: SMALL DIAMETER PIPE INSPECTION
description: A.?? ?INTRODUCTION Naval Undersea Warfare Center, Keyport is issuing this Request for Information (RFI) solely for information and planning purposes to conduct market research in support of Handling Systems Engineering Code 1534 In Service Engineering Agent (ISEA) for Towed Array Handling Systems. Interested parties will provide industry solutions for inspection of a small diameter pipe (1? ? 6?) in a marine environment. Many commercial off the shelf (COTS) products in the industries of sewer, heat exchanger, and pipe manufacturing inspection fulfill most but not all of the desired requirements. ? Interested companies with the technologies capable of meeting the desired general requirements may submit responses that include products current and expected capabilities with modifications. This RFI is not a request for proposal and the Government will reimburse no costs associated with response to this RFI. B.?? ?BACKGROUND The US Navy is seeking information on the industry capabilities for inspection system of a small diameter pipe (1? ? 6?). ?This pipe will be referred to as a guide or stowage tube, and is part of a system that a Towed Array travels through on deployment and retrieval cycles. ?The inspection systems major components would consist of a user control system, inspection device, and cable storage. ?This system would need to be portable so it could be deployed and setup pier side to access the entry point on the vessel. ?Power would be provided by a battery and/or use standard 120 VAC 60Hz power. ?The maximum working length needed to inspect a guide or stowage tube will account for distance from system user control station to entry of guide or stowage tube. ?Diver support would be used to assist the inspection effort and access the guide or stowage tube entry point. ?Due to limitations of access, an inspection device using internal sensors is preferred, as clearance for external sensors is limited. ?Along the inspection run, the inspection device must traverse a minimum bend radius. ?These bend radius sections are through roller box assemblies, which consist of rollers made of Delrin, which reduce friction through these turns during deployment and retrieval cycles. ?The inspection device would need to be waterproof and operate in a marine environment (regular immersion in salt water). ?This desired inspection device must be able to provide visual and measurement data of reasonable resolution in real time via a user control station and save this data for post analysis using a removable storage device. ?Accurate measurement would be expected for the following conditions of the stowage or guide tube: ?submerged in saltwater, partially submerged, or empty. ?Data collection is expected to be completed in a work day (8-12 Hrs.), for the required length of guide or stowage tube. ?The systems provided software program can be used to view visual and measurement data in real time. ?The location of the inspection device would be tracked and used to mark locations of interest for post analysis. ?This program could also be used to export data to commonly available software using removable storage media. ?For post analysis, standalone PC software is used to analyze ?raw? data from inspection system to generate a CAD file or inspection report. The small diameter pipe is part of either a Thinline or Fatline Towed Array Handling System (TAHS). ?Where the pipe is referred to as a guide tube in a Thinline system, and stowage tube in a Fatline system. ?The primary differences between these two systems is working length, pipe diameter, minimum bend radius, and presence of roller boxes. ?Requirements will be separated for inspection of each handing system, however there is interest in an inspection system capable of meeting the combined requirements of each handling system. Authorized personnel will provide feedback and any technical data necessary to facilitate responses on industry capabilities. C.?? ?REQUIREMENTS The following are the requirements of the inspection system: ? See Attached Thinline Guide Tube Inspection Requirements See Attached Fatline Stowage Tube Inspection Requirements 1. Thinline Towed Array Handling System: Measure Pipe Size: 2.00 in. Nominal Diameter Min. Bend Radius: 4 ft. Travel Through Roller Boxes: YES Max. Device Size: 1.45 in. Nominal Diameter Rigid Body Length at Max. Dia.: 5 in.? Cable Working Length: at least 325 ft. 2. Fatline Towed Array Handling System: Measure Pipe Size: 4.00 - 5.56 in. Nominal Diameter Min. Bend Radius: 8 ft. Roller Boxes: NO Max. Device Size: 3.5 in. Nominal Diameter Rigid Body Length at Max. Dia.: 9 in.? Cable working length: at least 400 ft. 3. Combined Thinline and Fatline System: Measure Pipe Size: 2.00 ? 5.56 in. Nominal Diameter Min. Bend Radius: 4 ft. Travel Through Roller Boxes: YES Max. Device Size: 1.45 in. Nominal Diameter Rigid Body Length at Max. Dia.: 5 in.? Cable working length: at least 400 ft.? D.?? ?QUESTIONS Responses to this RFI should answer the following questions: NOTE: If a requirement will not be met with a current system/device, please describe the expected/theoretical capability if component(s) are upgraded/modified. 1.?? ?Portability: ?? ?a.?? ?How long does it take to setup inspection system? ?? ?b.?? ?What is the total weight of the inspection system? And its major components? ?? ?c.?? ?Does the system have a suitable hard case or shock proofing during transportation? ?? ?d.?? ?What is the waterproof rating of the major system components? ?? ?e.?? ?Can the system be frequently exposed to saltwater? 2.?? ?Visual Inspection:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the size and resolution of the user control station display? ?? ?b.?? ?How is the visual and measurement data displayed on the user control station and/or PC? ?? ?c.?? ?What is the resolution of the camera output to the user control station? ?? ?d.?? ?Does the inspection device provide self-illumination? ?? ?e.?? ?Is the inspection device scratch resistant? ?? ?f.?? ?Is the inspection device self-leveling? ?? ?g.?? ?Is the inspection device self-centering? ?? ?h.?? ?Is the inspection device articulating? 3.?? ?Size: ?? ?a.?? ?What are the overall dimensions of the inspection system and its components? ?? ?b.?? ?What is the nominal diameter of the inspection device? ?? ?c.?? ?What is the rigid length at maximum diameter of the inspection device? ?? ? 4.?? ?Measurement: ? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the minimum and maximum pipe size that can be accurately measured? ?? ?b.?? ?What are the ranges of pipe size the inspection device can freely travel through? ?? ?c.?? ?Can the system inspect and traverse the following sections for Thinline requirements? ?? ??? ?i.?? ?1.65 in. Section less than 2 ft.? ?? ??? ?ii.?? ?2.03 in. Section up to 325 ft.? ?? ?b.?? ?Can the system inspect the following sections for Fatline requirements? ?? ??? ?i.?? ?5.00 in. Section up to 400 ft.? ?? ?d.?? ?What is the expected resolution of this measurement method? ?? ?e.?? ?Does the inspection device require internal or external sensors? ?? ?f.?? ?If any external sensors are used, what are the required clearances to obtain measurements? ?? ? ?? ?g.?? ?What is the approximate rate of acquiring measurement data per foot? ?? ?h.?? ?How is the position of the inspection device tracked within the pipe? ?? ?i.?? ?What is accuracy of the tracking the inspection device within the pipe? 5.?? ?Operating Environment:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the maximum operational depth measurement or pressure rating inspection device is able to be submerged in water?? ?? ?b.?? ?Can the inspection device routinely operate submerged in saltwater? ?? ?c.?? ?What is the accuracy of measurements provided when the pipe is full, partially full, or empty of water? ?? ?d.?? ?What is the minimum bend radius of the inspection device? ?? ?e.?? ?Can the inspection device operate through roller box assemblies? ?? ?f.?? ?Does the inspection device damage 70-30 Copper Nickel CuNi or Delrin 100 AF material? ?? ?g.?? ?What is the working length of the inspection system? ?? ?h.?? ?What type of materials are expected to be accurately measured? ?(Ferrous or nonferrous metals) Any materials that are theoretically not accurately measured? ?? ?i.?? ?Does the system user control station and cable storage resist saltwater corrosion? ?? ?j.?? ?What saltwater temperature range can the inspection device operate? ?? ?k.?? ?What ambient air temperature range can the inspection operate? 6.?? ?Software Analysis:? ?? ?a.?? ?Does the software on Control System allow measurement to be analyzed in both real time and post inspection? ?Can data be exported to a PC with software program to analyze inspection? ?? ?b.?? ?How is the inspection device?s position tracked and saved? ?? ?c.?? ?What type of file is generated for the visual and measurement data when exported from the user control station? ?? ?d.?? ?Can inspection system generate a report of inspection (location, visual, and measurement data)? 7. Media Format:? ?? ?a.?? ?What format are the inspection system video files? 8. Data Storage:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the maximum storage capacity for the inspection system? ?? ?b.?? ?How much pipe length, in feet, of visual and measurement data be stored for this capacity? ?? ?c.?? ?Can data be save or copied to an approved external memory device? 8. Power:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the maximum length system can perform an inspection on battery supply? ?? ?b.?? ?Can inspection system use standard 120 VAC 60Hz power? ?? ?c.?? ?Can the inspection system battery be charged when system is plugged into standard 120 VAC 60Hz power? 9. Schedule:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the timeframe needed to provide a concept/demonstration of a product that meets requirements? 10. Support:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the expected operational lifetime of the inspection system? ?? ?b.?? ?Will technical support and replacements parts be available during the expected lifetime of the inspections system? ?? ?c.?? ?Are there any potential technical, cost, schedule, or performance risks of concern? 11. Combined Inspection System: ?? ?a.?? ?Can inspection system meet both Thinline and Fatline requirements in Section C.3? ?? ?b.?? ?If not, what modifications would be necessary to meet both of these requirements? ?? ?c.?? ?Please provide any additional relevant information on combining requirements. E.?? ?Firms/companies are invited to indicate their capabilities by providing specifications, brochures, manuals, reports, demonstration videos and/or other technical data, as well as identification of current customers.? F.?? ? The Government recognizes that proprietary and/or classified data may be a part of this effort. If so, clearly mark such restricted/proprietary and classified data and present them as an addendum to the non-restricted/non-proprietary and unclassified information. G.?? ?POC Information: In order to be considered for this opportunity the following information is requested: **** Please specify in your DOCUMENT FILE NAME and ?DOCUMENT TITLE, wheather the solution is intended to meet ?specifications for THINLINE or FATLINE or (if applicable) ?both THINLINE and FATLINE ***** Business Name Point of Contact Name? POC Title? Mailing Address? Phone Number Fax Number? Email? Address Duns Number Website? Cage Code ?

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Bldg. 73 and 1058 Install HEPA Filter System
description: NAVSEA NUWC Division -Keyport has a requirement for two High EfficiencyParticulate Air (HEPA) filtration systems to be fabricated and installed on to the exhaust of two (2) dust collectors one each located at? bldg. 73 and bldg. 1058 . The project will require the contractor to fabricate and install ducting for each of the two HEPA filtration systems.? The filtration systems shall fit on the existing concrete pads with the dust collection units. The Contractor shall provide all the labor, materials, and equipment, as required, to perform the work.

title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Bldg 1074 AHU Replacement
description: Naval Underwater Warfare Center (NUWC) Division, Keyport has a requirement to replace a?roof top air-handling unit (AHU) and install five ductless split unit systems located at bldg. 1074. The project will?require the contractor to remove and replace existing HVAC equipment; provide and install five (5) new ductless?split unit systems, install electrical circuits, plumbing, and core drilling as required.

Power:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the maximum length system can perform an inspection on battery supply? ?? ?b.?? ?Can inspection system use standard 120 VAC 60Hz power? ?? ?c.?? ?Can the inspection system battery be charged when system is plugged into standard 120 VAC 60Hz power? 9. Schedule:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the timeframe needed to provide a concept/demonstration of a product that meets requirements? 10. Support:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the expected operational lifetime of the inspection system? ?? ?b.?? ?Will technical support and replacements parts be available during the expected lifetime of the inspections system? ?? ?c.?? ?Are there any potential technical, cost, schedule, or performance risks of concern? 11. Combined Inspection System: ?? ?a.?? ?Can inspection system meet both Thinline and Fatline requirements in Section C.3? ?? ?b.?? ?If not, what modifications would be necessary to meet both of these requirements? ?? ?c.?? ?Please provide any additional relevant information on combining requirements. category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids
title: SMALL DIAMETER PIPE INSPECTION
description: A.?? ?INTRODUCTION Naval Undersea Warfare Center, Newport Division (NUWCDIVNPT) is issuing this Request for Information (RFI) solely for information and planning purposes to conduct market research in support of Handling Systems Engineering Code 1534 In Service Engineering Agent (ISEA) for Towed Array Handling Systems. Interested parties will provide industry solutions for inspection of a small diameter pipe (1? ? 6?) in a marine environment. Many commercial off the shelf (COTS) products in the industries of sewer, heat exchanger, and pipe manufacturing inspection fulfill most but not all of the desired requirements. ? Interested companies with the technologies capable of meeting the desired general requirements may submit responses that include products current and expected capabilities with modifications. This RFI is not a request for proposal and the Government will reimburse no costs associated with response to this RFI. B.?? ?BACKGROUND The US Navy is seeking information on the industry capabilities for inspection system of a small diameter pipe (1? ? 6?). ?This pipe will be referred to as a guide or stowage tube, and is part of a system that a Towed Array travels through on deployment and retrieval cycles. ?The inspection systems major components would consist of a user control system, inspection device, and cable storage. ?This system would need to be portable so it could be deployed and setup pier side to access the entry point on the vessel. ?Power would be provided by a battery and/or use standard 120 VAC 60Hz power. ?The maximum working length needed to inspect a guide or stowage tube will account for distance from system user control station to entry of guide or stowage tube. ?Diver support would be used to assist the inspection effort and access the guide or stowage tube entry point. ?Due to limitations of access, an inspection device using internal sensors is preferred, as clearance for external sensors is limited. ?Along the inspection run, the inspection device must traverse a minimum bend radius. ?These bend radius sections are through roller box assemblies, which consist of rollers made of Delrin, which reduce friction through these turns during deployment and retrieval cycles. ?The inspection device would need to be waterproof and operate in a marine environment (regular immersion in salt water). ?This desired inspection device must be able to provide visual and measurement data of reasonable resolution in real time via a user control station and save this data for post analysis using a removable storage device. ?Accurate measurement would be expected for the following conditions of the stowage or guide tube: ?submerged in saltwater, partially submerged, or empty. ?Data collection is expected to be completed in a work day (8-12 Hrs.), for the required length of guide or stowage tube. ?The systems provided software program can be used to view visual and measurement data in real time. ?The location of the inspection device would be tracked and used to mark locations of interest for post analysis. ?This program could also be used to export data to commonly available software using removable storage media. ?For post analysis, standalone PC software is used to analyze ?raw? data from inspection system to generate a CAD file or inspection report. The small diameter pipe is part of either a Thinline or Fatline Towed Array Handling System (TAHS). ?Where the pipe is referred to as a guide tube in a Thinline system, and stowage tube in a Fatline system. ?The primary differences between these two systems is working length, pipe diameter, minimum bend radius, and presence of roller boxes. ?Requirements will be separated for inspection of each handing system, however there is interest in an inspection system capable of meeting the combined requirements of each handling system. Authorized personnel will provide feedback and any technical data necessary to facilitate responses on industry capabilities. C.?? ?REQUIREMENTS The following are the requirements of the inspection system: ? See Attached Thinline Guide Tube Inspection Requirements See Attached Fatline Stowage Tube Inspection Requirements 1. Thinline Towed Array Handling System: Measure Pipe Size: 2.00 in. Nominal Diameter Min. Bend Radius: 4 ft. Travel Through Roller Boxes: YES Max. Device Size: 1.45 in. Nominal Diameter Rigid Body Length at Max. Dia.: 5 in.? Cable Working Length: at least 325 ft. 2. Fatline Towed Array Handling System: Measure Pipe Size: 4.00 - 5.56 in. Nominal Diameter Min. Bend Radius: 8 ft. Roller Boxes: NO Max. Device Size: 3.5 in. Nominal Diameter Rigid Body Length at Max. Dia.: 9 in.? Cable working length: at least 400 ft. 3. Combined Thinline and Fatline System: Measure Pipe Size: 2.00 ? 5.56 in. Nominal Diameter Min. Bend Radius: 4 ft. Travel Through Roller Boxes: YES Max. Device Size: 1.45 in. Nominal Diameter Rigid Body Length at Max. Dia.: 5 in.? Cable working length: at least 400 ft.? D.?? ?QUESTIONS Responses to this RFI should answer the following questions: NOTE: If a requirement will not be met with a current system/device, please describe the expected/theoretical capability if component(s) are upgraded/modified. 1.?? ?Portability: ?? ?a.?? ?How long does it take to setup inspection system? ?? ?b.?? ?What is the total weight of the inspection system? And its major components? ?? ?c.?? ?Does the system have a suitable hard case or shock proofing during transportation? ?? ?d.?? ?What is the waterproof rating of the major system components? ?? ?e.?? ?Can the system be frequently exposed to saltwater? 2.?? ?Visual Inspection:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the size and resolution of the user control station display? ?? ?b.?? ?How is the visual and measurement data displayed on the user control station and/or PC? ?? ?c.?? ?What is the resolution of the camera output to the user control station? ?? ?d.?? ?Does the inspection device provide self-illumination? ?? ?e.?? ?Is the inspection device scratch resistant? ?? ?f.?? ?Is the inspection device self-leveling? ?? ?g.?? ?Is the inspection device self-centering? ?? ?h.?? ?Is the inspection device articulating? 3.?? ?Size: ?? ?a.?? ?What are the overall dimensions of the inspection system and its components? ?? ?b.?? ?What is the nominal diameter of the inspection device? ?? ?c.?? ?What is the rigid length at maximum diameter of the inspection device? ?? ? 4.?? ?Measurement: ? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the minimum and maximum pipe size that can be accurately measured? ?? ?b.?? ?What are the ranges of pipe size the inspection device can freely travel through? ?? ?c.?? ?Can the system inspect and traverse the following sections for Thinline requirements? ?? ??? ?i.?? ?1.65 in. Section less than 2 ft.? ?? ??? ?ii.?? ?2.03 in. Section up to 325 ft.? ?? ?b.?? ?Can the system inspect the following sections for Fatline requirements? ?? ??? ?i.?? ?5.00 in. Section up to 400 ft.? ?? ?d.?? ?What is the expected resolution of this measurement method? ?? ?e.?? ?Does the inspection device require internal or external sensors? ?? ?f.?? ?If any external sensors are used, what are the required clearances to obtain measurements? ?? ? ?? ?g.?? ?What is the approximate rate of acquiring measurement data per foot? ?? ?h.?? ?How is the position of the inspection device tracked within the pipe? ?? ?i.?? ?What is accuracy of the tracking the inspection device within the pipe? 5.?? ?Operating Environment:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the maximum operational depth measurement or pressure rating inspection device is able to be submerged in water?? ?? ?b.?? ?Can the inspection device routinely operate submerged in saltwater? ?? ?c.?? ?What is the accuracy of measurements provided when the pipe is full, partially full, or empty of water? ?? ?d.?? ?What is the minimum bend radius of the inspection device? ?? ?e.?? ?Can the inspection device operate through roller box assemblies? ?? ?f.?? ?Does the inspection device damage 70-30 Copper Nickel CuNi or Delrin 100 AF material? ?? ?g.?? ?What is the working length of the inspection system? ?? ?h.?? ?What type of materials are expected to be accurately measured? ?(Ferrous or nonferrous metals) Any materials that are theoretically not accurately measured? ?? ?i.?? ?Does the system user control station and cable storage resist saltwater corrosion? ?? ?j.?? ?What saltwater temperature range can the inspection device operate? ?? ?k.?? ?What ambient air temperature range can the inspection operate? 6.?? ?Software Analysis:? ?? ?a.?? ?Does the software on Control System allow measurement to be analyzed in both real time and post inspection? ?Can data be exported to a PC with software program to analyze inspection? ?? ?b.?? ?How is the inspection device?s position tracked and saved? ?? ?c.?? ?What type of file is generated for the visual and measurement data when exported from the user control station? ?? ?d.?? ?Can inspection system generate a report of inspection (location, visual, and measurement data)? 7. Media Format:? ?? ?a.?? ?What format are the inspection system video files? 8. Data Storage:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the maximum storage capacity for the inspection system? ?? ?b.?? ?How much pipe length, in feet, of visual and measurement data be stored for this capacity? ?? ?c.?? ?Can data be save or copied to an approved external memory device? 8. Power:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the maximum length system can perform an inspection on battery supply? ?? ?b.?? ?Can inspection system use standard 120 VAC 60Hz power? ?? ?c.?? ?Can the inspection system battery be charged when system is plugged into standard 120 VAC 60Hz power? 9. Schedule:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the timeframe needed to provide a concept/demonstration of a product that meets requirements? 10. Support:? ?? ?a.?? ?What is the expected operational lifetime of the inspection system? ?? ?b.?? ?Will technical support and replacements parts be available during the expected lifetime of the inspections system? ?? ?c.?? ?Are there any potential technical, cost, schedule, or performance risks of concern? 11. Combined Inspection System: ?? ?a.?? ?Can inspection system meet both Thinline and Fatline requirements in Section C.3? ?? ?b.?? ?If not, what modifications would be necessary to meet both of these requirements? ?? ?c.?? ?Please provide any additional relevant information on combining requirements. E.?? ?Firms/companies are invited to indicate their capabilities by providing specifications, brochures, manuals, reports, demonstration videos and/or other technical data, as well as identification of current customers.? F.?? ? The Government recognizes that proprietary and/or classified data may be a part of this effort. If so, clearly mark such restricted/proprietary and classified data and present them as an addendum to the non-restricted/non-proprietary and unclassified information. G.?? ?POC Information: In order to be considered for this opportunity the following information is requested: **** Please specify in your DOCUMENT FILE NAME and ?DOCUMENT TITLE, wheather the solution is intended to meet ?specifications for THINLINE or FATLINE or (if applicable) ?both THINLINE and FATLINE ***** Business Name Point of Contact Name? POC Title? Mailing Address? Phone Number Fax Number? Email? Address Duns Number Website? Cage Code

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Moses Lake ATCT HVAC Controls Upgrade
description: ******Clarifications^^^^^^^ 4/5/2022 1) Due date is May 6, 2022 not May 13. A revised SF-1442 will be released as soon as I am able to. 2) Estimated start should be July 2022. This document defines the requirements to design and construct a new Building Automation System (BAS) for the Moses Lake, Washington Air Traffic Control Tower (MWH) and Base Building located at 7820 Andrews St NE Moses Lake, WA 98837. All existing controls equipment should be demolished and replaced with a new system, including the replacement of all control dampers. The new system should have the capacity to control and monitor the status of each of the roof top units (RTUs) and be able to control and monitor the temperature in each of the zones being served by the RTUs. The upgraded system shall utilize BACnet as the communications protocol and all new equipment should be BACnet compatible. Precision air conditioning (PAC) units in link and on intermediate floors should be tied into the new control system.

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Replacement of 18 Central A/C Unit at 9 Locks & Dams
description: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers - St. Paul District seeks a contractor to supply and install 18 central air conditioning units and cooling coils located at nine lock & dam sites along the Upper Mississippi River in Minnesota, Wisconsin and Iowa. The existing units use R-22 refrigerant. Replacement systems shall use R410A approved standard refrigerant. Replacement shall include, but is not limited to, removal and disposal of existing units (including refrigerant), replacing any missing or damaged duct work and insulation, installation of new units, making all connections, charging system, and checking for leaks. Units shall be started and tested in accordance with manufacturer recommendations.? Some of the units are mounted on roof tops, and will require use of a crane or articulating lift. A vendor must provide a price on all items in this solicitation to be eligible for award. The Government will award on an ?All or None? basis. Evaluation of bids/offers will be based upon only the total price included on the pricing schedule for all items. The estimated magnitude of construction is between $100,000 and $250,000.? The NAICS Code for this acquisition is 238220 - Plumbing, Heating and Air Conditioning Contractors. The size standard for this NAICS is $16,500,000.? This solicitation is 100% set-aside for small businesses.? Interested parties are highly encouraged to make site visits to the locations. Please use the Points of Contact listed in the Solicitation SOW to schedule visits during working hours.? Please include the manufacturer, model numbers, and specifications (i.e. cut sheets) of all equipment your firm is quoting, to ensure that it meets specifications. Please include the Country of Origin for all equipment with your quote. OFFEROR SHALL BE REGISTERED IN SAM (System for Award Management) ?https://www.sam.gov ?to include the FAR and DFARS Reps and Certs sections with the NAICS code applicable to the solicitation. ? AMENDMENT 0001 HAS BEEN ADDED. This amendment extends the delivery date to November 30, 2022, adds Item 0019 (LD5 Unit #3), removes the requirement to change the ductwork to accept 2" filters, and extends the solicitation close.?

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids
title: Heating Ventilation & Air Conditioning (HVAC) Solution Energy Recovery-Based Recirculating Air Handling Unit (AHU) Sources Sought
description: Sources Sought for solution. The 718th Civil Engineering Squadron (718 CES) has identified a potential need for an innovative Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning(HVAC) solution on Kadena Air Base that can meet stringent dehumidification and temperature control requirements utilizing a simple, low maintenance energy recovery system to perform reheat duties for the relative humidity and temperature control process. The Government anticipates a need for this energy recovery-based recirculating air handling unit (ER-AHU) HVAC solution in a facility that requires strict temperature and relative humidity control, utilizing AHUs that combine fresh air with recirculated return air and provide supply air that is both dew point temperature and dry bulb temperature controlled.

title: REPLACE FIRE SUPPRESSION LINE - EARTHQUAKE RESISTANT AT HACHINOHE POL DEPOT, JAPAN
description: Amendment 0001 is issued to postpone the site visit date and time from 14 Apr 2022, 09:00 AM to 26 Apr?2022, 09:00 AM and to extend the bid due date and time from 11 May 2022, 11:00 AM to 23 May 2022, 11:00 AM. The Contractor shall furnish all labor, materials, equipment, transportation, supervision, and engineering necessary to REPLACE FIRE SUPPRESSION LINE - EARTHQUAKE RESISTANT AT HACHINOHE POL DEPOT, JAPAN in accordance with the Specification and drawings herewith. Access is restricted for Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI), e.g. specification and drawings.? Please request the access on the SAM with your firm?s DUNS # and CAGE Code. AUTHORIZATION TO PERFORM: In accordance with DFARS 252.225-7042, the Offeror must be duly authorized to operate and to do business in Japan. CONTRACTOR LICENSING REQUIREMENTS: Any contract resulting from this solicitation will be awarded and performed in its entirety in the country of Japan. Contractors must be duly authorized to operate and conduct business in Japan and must fully comply with all laws, decrees, labor standards, and regulations of Japan during the performance of the contract. Prior to award of any contract, offerors must be registered to do business and possess a construction license (Kensetsu Gyo Kyoka) issued by the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport, or prefectural government. Offerors will be required to provide verification on such construction license prior to award of any contract to the contracting officer if such information is not already on file with or available to the contracting officer. Furthermore, the U.S. Government will not offer ?United States Official Contractor? status under Article XIV of the U.S.-Japan Status of Forces Agreement (SOFA) to any offeror awarded a contract under this solicitation; nor will the U.S. Government designate eligible employee(s) as ?Members of the Civilian Component? under Article I(b) of the SOFA." BID CURRENCY: Bids shall be priced only in Japanese Yen. At the discretion of the Contracting Officer, bids not priced in Japanese Yen will be considered nonresponsive and will not be evaluated. In accordance with FAR 36.204, the magnitude of construction is between ?50,000,000 and ?100,000,000 52.236-27???? SITE VISIT (CONSTRUCTION) (FEB 1995) (a)?? The clauses at 52.236-2, Differing Site Conditions, and 52.236-3, Site Investigations and Conditions Affecting the Work, will be included in any contract awarded as a result of this solicitation. title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) USS PORTLAND (LPD-27) Vault Door
description: This is a Request for Information (RFI), i.e. sources sought notice, for information and acquisition planning purposes. The Government is seeking small business concerns.?This is not a request for quote (RFQ) and a formal solicitation is not available at this time. This notice does not constitute a commitment by the Government to issue an RFQ, contract, or purchase order. The Government will not pay for any effort expended or any material provided in response to this announcement, nor will the Government return any data provided. Southwest Regional Maintenance Center (SWRMC) is seeking vendors to procure/manufacturer item listed in the product description (See Attachment). The contractor shall furnish all labor, equipment, and materials required to accomplish the work described.? SWRMC is contemplating the award of a single firm fixed price contract/purchase order for the requirement specified above. The applicable NAICS code is 332321. Interested vendors?shall submit a capabilities statement (not to exceed five pages) that demonstrates their capability to perform the services described herein. The capabilities statement shall include: -Company name -Cage Code?  -Address -Business size (small, small disadvantaged, 8(a), women-owned, HUBZone, veteran-owned, or service-disabled veteran-owned) [more than one category may be selected as applicable] -Point of contact (POC) information for the interested company -Company's technical capabilities The capabilities statement should also identify, by contract number, past or current contracts and/or subcontracts that were awarded to the respondent company, period of performance, contract type, contract amount, a description of the relevant corporate experience gained, and a point of contact for the customer/recipient of the work performed. The Government will evaluate each respondent's capabilities statement to determine if the respondent has the requisite experience and past performance to complete the requirements described herein. No telephone inquiries will be accepted. The Government does not commit to providing a response to any comments or questions. No basis for a claim against the Government shall arise as a result of this announcement. Responses should be received no later than 5 May 2022, 11:00 pm (PST). All responses should be forwarded to Mr. Jordan Trujillo, email: jordan.r.trujillo@navy.mil.

title: 7230--Supply: Lake Nona DOM Mecho Shades
description: The Orlando Veterans Affairs Healthcare System Contracting Office intends to solicit and award an acquisition for Mecho Shades for the Orlando VA Healthcare System in Orlando, Florida. The Primary North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) for this acquisition is 337920, with a related small business size standard of 1,000 employees. The proposed actions are for a firm-fixed price, which will be advertised as a set aside to small business. The solicitation will be posted via https://sam.gov/content/home website on or about 05/06/2022. The solicitation and incorporated provisions and clauses are in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06, 05/01/2022. It is the responsibility of the quoter to review the web page for notice of amendments, updates or changes to the solicitation. To be eligible for award prospective offerors must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) Internet site, https://sam.gov/content/home. Reference solicitation section E for further instructions and details to submit solicitation. For further information, please contact Contract Specialist Jessica Kiser, jessica.kiser@va.gov. ALL RESPONSES ARE DUE VIA EMAIL TO JESSICA.KISER@VA.GOV BY 05/13/2022, AT 16:00 PM EASTERN STANDARD TIME (EST).

description: Legal Notice # 21721093 NOTICE TO BIDDERS Notice is hereby given that sealed bids will be received and publicly read by The Board of Education, East Islip Union Free School District, Town of Islip, Suffolk County, New York on Thursday, June 2nd, 2022 at 10:30 A.M. for the following bid: BID# 060222-2 GLASS REPLACEMENT & MAINTENANCE SERVICES Sealed bids should be addressed to the attention of Samantha Neff, School Purchasing Agent, East Islip Union Free School District, Business Office, 1 Craig B. Gariepy Avenue, Islip Terrace, New York 11752. All bids must be submitted to the Office of the School Purchasing Agent on or before the date of opening in a sealed envelope, bearing on the outside the name and address of the bidder and the title of the bid. Any bids received after the time and date specified will not be considered. Specifications and bid form may be obtained from the district's website http://www.eischools.org, Empire State Purchasing Group's website https://www.bidnetdirect.com or at the above office, weekdays, between 9:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m. Bid prices shall be irrevocable for a minimum period of forty-five (45) days from the date of the bid opening. The Board of Education reserves the right to reject any and all bids, or to award contracts which, in its judgment, are in the best interest of the school district. To assure that all bidders are familiar with the Scope of Work, a site walkthrough will be conducted on Monday, May 16th, 2022 at 10:00 A.M. All bidders shall assemble at the Buildings and Grounds office of the East Islip School District, 1 Craig B. Gariepy Avenue, Islip Terrace, New York. All bidders are urged to attend. Dated: May 5, 2022 By Order of Board of Education East Islip Union Free School District Town of Islip, New York County of Suffolk Islip Terrace, New York 11752 Samantha Neff School Purchasing Agent (631) 224-2031

title: Window Replacement
description: This project is to remove the existing single pane windows and replace them with new double pane windows. The existing windows are made of wood and are showing signs of deterioration and water infiltration. The replacement windows will be aluminum clad and double pane, providing for both an increase in energy efficiency and weather protection. The new windows will match the historic look of the existing windows, with laminated glass used on the first floor windows for safety purposes.

title: 5680--Copy of Equipment, Fire Door/Hardware, CIN
description: SOW Contract Title. 2 fire doors with all al the hardware for installation. 3. Background. The intent of this contract is for the Cincinnati VA Medical Center to purchase TWO (2) 3 - 7 15/16 X 6 - 11 7/8 ULC RNB 4 X 25 LO PRO KIT FIRE LITE NT GLASS HALF MORTISE EDGE GUARDS CLEAR FINISH RHR WOOD DOORS and (2) CORBIN RUSSWIN ED5470B W048 H0700 M55 630 RR SURFACE VERTICAL ROD DEVICES, (6) HAGER BB1168 4.5 X 4.5 US26D FULL MORTISE HINGES, (1) ALARM LOCK ETDL2700 T2 LC US26D TRILOGY EXIT TRIM, and (2) ROCKWOOD K4125 16" X 41" CLEAR PLASTIC PROTECTION PLATE for the VA medical center here in Cincinnati, Ohio. 4. Scope. This contract is for the VAMC, Cincinnati, Ohio Engineering department for the Carpentry shop to install, it is expected that the equipment will be fully functional upon delivery to the VAMC. 5. Specific Tasks. Purchase TWO (2) 3 - 7 15/16 X 6 - 11 7/8 ULC RNB 4 X 25 LO PRO KIT FIRE LITE NT GLASS HALF MORTISE EDGE GUARDS CLEAR FINISH RHR WOOD DOORS and two (2) CORBIN RUSSWIN ED5470B W048 H0700 M55 630 RR SURFACE VERTICAL ROD DEVICES, six (6) HAGER BB1168 4.5 X 4.5 US26D FULL MORTISE HINGES, one (1) ALARM LOCK ETDL2700 T2 LC US26D TRILOGY EXIT TRIM, and two (2) ROCKWOOD K4125 16" X 41" CLEAR PLASTIC PROTECTION PLATES. 6. Performance Monitoring Inspection will be performed upon delivery by engineering Carpentry shop, once completed, Staff operating products will monitor equipment for failures. Premature failures will be reported to the distributor and manufacturer, for quality control corrections as well as replacement. PM s (fire door inspections) will be done by staff. 7. Security Requirements This equipment does not store patient data or other health care information. However, will have to be supplied with operating keys. 8. Government-Furnished Equipment (GFE)/Government-Furnished Information (GFI). None. 9. Other Pertinent Information or Special Considerations. None. a. Identification of Possible Follow-on Work. None. b. Identification of Potential Conflicts of Interest (COI). None. c. Identification of Non-Disclosure Requirements. None. d. Packaging, Packing and Shipping Instructions. Entire purchase will be delivered/installed to the Cincinnati VA Medical Center/Engineering department. Engineering specifically the Carpentry shop will need to perform a safety check, and an acceptance inspection upon receipt, and enter them into the system for Fire door inspections. e. Inspection and Acceptance Criteria.

description: AMENDMENT NOTICE: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is BENNING6THRTBSAM0001 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 321114 with a small business size standard of 500.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified offerors may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-05-12 11:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerors that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. However, you may also file a protest to the Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 35 calendar days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The Small Business Size Standard for this NAICS code is $16.5 Million. This acquisition shall be available as a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) set aside. Period of Performance: 90 Days Description: See attached Statement of Work (SOW) Award will be made to the responsible contractor considering price and technical proposal. Quotes must include a technical proposal indicating how you intend to meet the requirements in the SOW and specifications. This proposal is to include, but not limited to: specification sheets for both carpet and base cove or any pertinent information that will allow the government to evaluate the item/s you have proposed. Quotes received that do not have an adequate proposal will not be considered for award. ?List of Attachments: Attachment I, Statement of Work Dated 22 March 2022 Attachment II, Quote Sheet Attachment III, FAR 52.228-5 Insurance Requirements Attachment IV, Carpet Specifications 09 68 13- Tile Carpeting Specs V2 Attachment V, Service Contract Act Wage Determination No. 2015-5314 Attachment VI, FAR & DFAR Provisions Attachment VII, FAR & DFAS Clauses A site visit is scheduled for 19 May 2022 @ 10:00AM CST. All contractor?s interested in attending the site visit should contact Mr. Darin L Brun at darin.brun@us.af.mil or 316-759-7591 NLT 17 May 2022. All visitors without a current badge to access McConnell AFB will be required to obtain a visitor?s pass through the Main Gate off Rock Rd. To drive to the site visit location please ensure you have Driver?s License, Proof of Insurance and current registration for your vehicle to obtain a visitor?s pass. The building where the project is located is a secure facility and to enter you must be a US Citizen. A driver?s license (valid Government ID) and SSN will need to be provided at the building to gain access. Additionally, no cell phones/PEDs/smart watches or smart devices are allowed in the facility. No cameras; if a picture is required the government will provide the picture. All questions are due by 2 June 2022, 1:00 PM CST to Mr. Darin Brun at darin.brun@us.af.mil. All offerors must be registered in System for Award Management (SAM) prior to submitting quote. Information concerning SAM requirements may be viewed via https://www.sam.gov/SAM/ or by calling the Federal Service Help Desk at 1-866-606-8220 Quotes shall be provided on the attached bid sheet, signed, dated and submitted by 8 June 2022, 1:00 PM CST to both point of contacts listed below. The Offeror is responsible for ensuring the quote is received by the Government by the due date and time specified above. Failure to send quotes to both POCs or verify receipt of the quote may result in not being considered for award. ??????? Email submissions of proposals WILL be accepted. ??????? Send emails to: darin.brun@us.af.mil? & brent.geschwentner@us.af.mil ????? Facsimile proposals WILL NOT be accepted. ??????? Hand Deliver Proposals to: Mr. Darin Brun ??? ??? 52955 Jayhawk Dr. ??? ??? Bldg. 65 Room 153, ???? ?? McConnell AFB, Ks 67221 ???? ?? Tel: 316-759-7590

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: Flooring, Carpet, Tile Work Bids
title: Buy Indian Set-Aside (specific to Department of Health and Human Services, Indian Health Services): Northern Cheyenne Service Unit Flooring Project
buyer: Department of Health and Human Services
agency: Department of Health and Human Services
description: This is a SOLICITATION NOTICE, Solicitation 75H701-22-R-00028 for the Northern Cheyenne Service Unit Flooring Project in Lame Deer, MT, a construction project for the Indian Health Service (IHS), Division of Engineering Services. The full scope of work, specifications, drawings, and all other documents are attached. This requirement is a total Indian Small Business Economic Enterprise (ISBEE) set-aside and the associated NAICS is 238330 ? Flooring Contractors, with small business size standard of $16.5 Million. Non-ISBEE or Indian Small Business Firm offerors will not be considered for the award unless more than two fair and reasonable ISBEE offers are not received.?In the case that more than two ISBEE offers are not received, then Indian Economic Enterprises (IEE) receive next priority. If more than two ISBEE or IEE offers are not received, then consideration for all Small Businesses will be given. For information concerning NAICS and SBA size standards, go to https://www.sba.gov. SCOPE OF WORK:? The scope of this project is to replace carpeting and vinyl composition tile (VCT) flooring in the main hallways and corridors and other designated areas. LOCATION OF PROJECT:? All work shall be performed at the Northern Cheyenne Service Unit located in Lame Deer, MT. TERO: TERO is applicable. CONSTRUCTION DURATION:? Period of Performance is 90 calendar days from issuance of the Notice to Proceed. CONSTRUCTION MAGNITUDE: The magnitude of this construction project is anticipated to be between $250,000 and $500,000, in accordance with FAR 36.204(g). SITE VISIT:? An organized site visit has been scheduled for Thursday May 5th, 2022 (unless amended). Refer to solicitation, Section L.8., FAR 52.236-27. NOTE: ALL DATES ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE. SEE SOLICITATION FOR OFFICIAL DATES, TIMES, AND LOCATIONS OF SITE VISITS AND DEADLINES. It is the responsibility of the contractor to check https://sam.gov/ frequently for any amendments or changes to the solicitation. Hard copy documents will NOT be available ? all documents for proposal purposes will be posted at the website for download by interested parties. This solicitation will be procured as a Request for Proposal in accordance with FAR Part 15 and 36 procedures with Lowest Price Technically Acceptable evaluation criteria. CONTRACT TYPE:? The Indian Health Service intends to award a Firm Fixed Price (FFP) construction contract in support of this requirement. NOTE: Registration in the System for Award Management (SAM) database is mandatory to be considered for award. Offerors may obtain information on registration and annual confirmation requirements via the internet at: https://www.sam.gov. Contractors are encouraged to complete SAM registration as soon as possible; the Government may not delay award for the purpose of allowing a contractor additional time to register in SAM. This notice is for informational purposes only and is NOT a request for submission of offers. No other information is available until issuance of the solicitation itself. No bidders list is maintained. All potential bidders should register with https://sam.gov/ if interested in this forthcoming acquisition. Interested bidders (offerors) can follow this pre-solicitation notice by creating an account at https://sam.gov/. After entering Login.gov credentials, go to ?Contract Opportunities?, find the notice then click on the ?Follow? tool to receive email notifications for any updates to the project including the posting of the solicitation and any subsequent amendments. Primary Point of Contact: Jeffrey Haubenreiser Contract Specialist jeffrey.haubenreiser@ihs.gov Phone: 214-767-8588 Secondary Point of Contact: Andrew Hart Contracting Officer Andrew.Hart@ihs.gov Phone: 206-615-2453

title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) Carpet Removal and Installation
description: The 27th Special Operations Civil Engineer Squadron requires carpet to be replaced throughout building 1435; approximately 871 square yards rolled goods, 842 linear feet of rolled cove, and 582 linear feet of transition strip. Carpet procurement and installation must comply with specifications outlined in the Unified Facilities Criteria (UFC) 4-740-14 Design: Child Development Centers (USACE and Air Force Only) paragraph 7-1.6.1.2. The materials shall be delivered in the manufacturer's original wrappings and packaging, unless approved in advance by the CO or COR. When delivered to the worksite, each roll of carpet shall have the original sticker/tag from the manufacturer, containing information to include the color, run number, pattern and carpet quality. Please email submissions to both Primary and Secondary Contacts.

title: Repair of Concrete Floor
description: This project funds the repair of concrete floor located in Aggie Dome. The contractor is route and seal cracks that are greater than hairline throughout the building. In 107 contractor is to fill in all preexisting drains, electrical floor boxes and holes and other object that protrude from floor causing a non- continuous slab in concrete floor; use industry methods to level the floor located at the south side of the structure. Remove electrical whips, other electrical devices and conduit out of the floor in rooms 101and 102; patch area and level. Electrical wire will be removed from before construction.

title: Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) Set-Aside (FAR 19.14) OR Flooring Replacement
description: Construction Project: 757-22-501, OR Floor Replacement Contractor shall provide all labor, equipment, supplies?and supervision necessary for the OR Floor Replacement?project at the Wylie P. Chalmers VA Ambulatory Care VAACC, 420 N. James Rd, Columbus, OH 43219. Period of Performance: 10 Calendar Days after issuance of Notice to Proceed. The project magnitude for the project is between $0 and $25,000. NAICS: 236220, Commercial and Institutional Building Construction. The business size standard is $39.5 All work to be performed in accordance with the Drawings and Salient Characteristics included in this solicitation. All work shall be coordinated with the Veterans Affairs (VA) Contracting Officer and the Contracting Officer's?Representative (COR). All Bidders/Offerors shall insert bid(s) in the appropriate block(s) on the attached sheet titled "SF 1442 Block 17 Continuation on page?5 ." Proposal(s) will be evaluated on price. Emailed proposals will be accepted and should be emailed to Stanley Burdine at stanley.burdine@va.gov. Site Visit and place of performance is at Wylie P. Chalmers VA Ambulatory Care VAACC, 420 N. James Rd, Columbus, OH?43219. An organized site visit will be conducted in accordance with FAR 52.236?27 and social distancing?guidelines?see solicitation section titled "SITE VISIT INFORMATION" on page 24. Cut?off date and time to submit Requests for Information (RFI) is 05-11-2022 at 12PM EST. RFIs shall be emailed to?Stanley Burdine at stanley.burdine@va.gov. No phone/fax inquiries will be accepted. Responses to the RFIs will be made?via amendments to the solicitation via FBO. This project is a 100% setaside for a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB). All bidders must be verified in VETBIZ and registered in SAM at the time of the offer due date and the time of award to be eligible for award. For eligibility under the NAICS, see VAAR 852.219.10 paragraph for performance requirements. Public Law 105?339, Section 1534 provides "no agency may obligate or expend funds appropriated for the agency for a fiscal year to enter a contract described in Section 4212(a) of Title 38 with a contractor from which a report was required under Section 4212(d) of that title with respect to the preceding fiscal year, if such contractor did not submit?such report."

title: Flooring Replacement Facility 288, Vance Air Force Base
description: Edit #4 - Question asked about pictures of furniture systems in place. Please see attachment Question 2 answered. Added 2 pictures.? Also added a bigger scale drawing of area to be carpeted. Edit #3 - question was asked about how to submit Bids.?Please see attachment Question 1 answered Edit # 2 - Question & Answer Form added to attachments. Please send form with one question per form to carmella.holtz.ctr@us.af.mil by 3 pm on 5/6/22. Edit #1 - SITE VISIT SCHEDULED : MONDAY APRIL 25, 2022 AT 10:00 AM. Please email carmella.holtz.ctr@us.af.mil if you plan to attend and require base access assistance. The flooring materials in the CE admin areas sustained significant water damage.?? ?The contractor will remove existing furniture in preparation of work and remove existing broadloom carpet, wall base and transition strips in areas indicated on sheets I101 and I102 found in APPENDIX B. They will then install new modular carpet tile, rubber wall base and transition strips in accordance with manufacturers recommended practices. After flooring products have been installed, the contractor will reinstall all furniture. Additional details are described below: 1. Remove existing furniture and reserve for future reinstallation 2. Remove existing broadloom carpet, transition strips and wall base ? ? ? ? ? ?a. Existing carpet: 10,593 SF ? ? ? ? ? ?b. Existing wall base: 2,815 LF 3. Prepare surfaces for installation of new materials 4. Install new modular carpet tile  a. New Carpet: 11,653 SF (includes 10% waste factor)  b. Product? to be installed ? ? ? ? ?1. Manufacturer: Milliken Flooring 2. Style: Arctic Survey  3. Pattern: Expedition4. Color: Subzero  5. Installation method: Ashlar 5. Install new transition strips to match wall base as needed between flooring materials? where change in level will exceed ??. 6. Install new wall base ? ? ? ? ? a. New wall base: 2,815 LF ? ? ? ? ? b. Product to be installed ? ? ? ? ?1. Manufacturer: Mannington ? ? ? ? ?2. Style: Burkebase, standard toe ? ? ? ? ?3. Size: 4? ? ? ? ? ?4. Color: Charcoal 7. Reinstall all furniture C. Clean site to preconstruction or better. D. The Contractor shall provide a standard 1 year Contractor?s warranty for all labor and material from date of the base?s acceptance of completion. E. As part of the bid package the Contractor shall submit a completed copy of APPENDIX A-SCHEDULE C. F. Proposals to include not less than prevailing wage labor rate for Garfield County, OK. G. Proposals must be valid for a minimum of 90 days. H. Owner reserves the right to reject any bid which does not completely satisfy the scope of work above. I. The Contractor shall reserve remaining material for use by the government as attic stock. AS STATED IN THE STATEMENT OF WORK.

title: Basketball Area Floor Maintenance
description:
CPC Basketball Area Floor Maintenance

Solicitation ID: UTA22-AthleticsCPCFloor
Status: Posted
Contact Name: Christopher Harris
Contact Number: 817-272-6858
Contact Email: christopher.harris2@uta.edu
Response Due Time: 3:00 PM
Response Due Date: 5/18/2022
Agency/Texas SmartBuy Member Number: 714
Solicitation Description:
Project Scope
 Sand and edge maple gym floor with coarse, medium, fine, and extra fine sandpaper.
 Screen with 100 grit mesh screen discs.
 Vacuum and tack entire sanded floor.
 Apply 2 coats of Emulsion Wood Floor Sealer.
 Screen with 120 grit mesh screen discs.
 Vacuum and tack entire sanded floor.
 Tape game lines as existing.
 Apply 2 coats of water-based enamel paint to taped areas.
 Furnish stencils and paint graphics and lettering, to be determined.
 Changes in lettering and graphics.
 Vacuum and clean entire sanded floor.
 Supply 1 case Squeaky Cleaner for maintenance.
 Repair and/or replace broken maple boards with matching maple flooring, lacing the repair back into the existing court.
 Estimate of approximately 20 boards will need to be repaired.
 Stripped and painted with Bona Court matching system paints per graphics design.
 Two (2) coats of WATER-based finish will then be applied to the entire court surface. Sealed with two coats Bona Sport penetrating water-based sealer.
 Apply 2 coats of Gym Shoe gloss Wood Floor Finish.
 MUST BE ABLE TO COMPLETE PROJECT OFF-SITE.
NOTICE TO BIDDERS AND PROPOSERS
The University of Texas at Arlington now utilizes the Texas Purchasing Group on the BidNet on-line platform for all bid and proposal submissions. To obtain bid or proposal documents, along with all submittal requirements and instructions, please go to:
https://www.bidnetdirect.com/texas/uta
If you are already registered with BidNet, you will simply login to gain access to the Texas Purchasing Group page. Then, select The University of Texas at Arlington link for access to open solicitations and related documents.
If this is your first time using BidNet, select the Vendor Registration link to register. Once registered, select the Texas Purchasing Group Page. Then, select The University of Texas at Arlington link for access to open solicitations and related documents.
Access to and ability to respond to UTA solicitation documents is free for vendors utilizing the Limited Access registration option. If you choose to register and/or pay for other enhanced services, that is at your discretion but is not required to download and respond to UTA solicitations.
In the event of problems logging in, contact BidNet support at:
800-835-4603 (option 2) or eprocurementsupport@bidnet.com

category_id: Trades and Subcontracts: Fence, Gate, Guardrail Bids
title: Subcontractors Needed: Fencing
buyer: Kiewit Infrastructure West - Santa Fe Springs
agency: Kiewit Infrastructure West - Santa Fe Springs
description:
Kiewit Infrastructure West Co.

An Equal Opportunity Employer,
is requesting quotations from all qualified

DBE,MBE,WBE,SBE

sub-contractors and material suppliers for the following project:

Oliver P. Roemer Water Filtration Facility 2022 Upgrades and Expansion

City/Location: Rialto, CA

County: San Bernardino

Owner: West Valley Water District

Bid Date: Friday 5/13/2022 at 5:00 PM

We are requesting bids for the following trades and/or supplies:

Kiewit is requesting sub-quotes for various scopes of work, but not limited to:fencing

NAICS Classifications
Sector 23--Construction
All Other Specialty Trade Contractors
Highway, Street, and Bridge Construction
Masonry Contractors
Other Building Equipment Contractors
Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction
Painting and Wall Covering Contractors
Plumbing, Heating, and Air-Conditioning Contractors
Poured Concrete Foundation and Structure Contractors
Roofing Contractors
Site Preparation Contractors
Structural Steel and Precast Concrete Contractors
Water and Sewer Line and Related Structures Construction



Bid documents can be viewed at or obtained from:


Firms interested in receiving a bid package for this project must contact us at the e-mail address noted. Responding firms will be issued an gInvitation to Bidh through Kiewitfs electronic use of SmartBid system (at no cost to bidder) with project information and bid instructions. Plans and specifications will also be available for review at 10704 Shoemaker Ave, Santa Fe Springs, CA 90670



The work is to upgrade and expand treatment capacity at the Roemer WFF by 7.2 MGD. This expansion in capacity is also necessary to allow the District to utilize additional SWP water and relax pumping of their groundwater wells. This operation shift will allow groundwater levels to recover and ensure that the District can continue to provide water to meet its customers needs. The District is planning to expand the Roemer WFF from the current 14.4 MGD to 21.6 MGD to treat additional SWP water. The Project will provide additional treated water capacity using proven technology to treat water.

The project is subject to the Project Labor Agreement. This project is also partially funded by the State Water Resources Control Board (SWRCB) State Revolving Fund (Loan) and is subject but not limited to the American Iron and Steel (AIS), Build America, Buy America Act (BABA) requirements to the use of iron and steel products that are produced in the United States, DBE program requirements and the Davis-Bacon Related Acts.

Responsive bidders must possess a valid California Contractorfs license (as appropriate), be registered with the Department of Industrial Relations (DIR) and provide acceptable insurance. Responsible subcontractors and material contractors will be required to provide bonding for 100% of their contract value. Kiewit will reimburse bond premiums. Firms performing any onsite work is signatory to collective bargaining agreements with the carpenters, laborers, cement masons, ironworkers, operating engineers, and teamsters. Kiewit will consider quotes from any, and all bidders who demonstrate an ability to foster and maintain labor harmony on the Project.

Kiewit intends to conduct itself in good faith with all DBEs as defined above and all other business enterprises regarding participation on this project. For further information regarding this project, licensing, insurance or bonding, equipment, supplies, materials, or related assistance or services or project schedule, please contact the Lead Estimator listed below.

Kiewit Infrastructure West Co.
10704 Shoemaker Ave., Santa Fe Springs, CA 90670
Tel: (562) 946-1816  Fax: (562) 946-3823
Lead Estimator: Branden Willcut
Email: Branden.Willcut@kiewit.com

gKiewit Infrastructure West Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.h

description: The Army Contracting Command - Rock Island (ACC-RI) hereby issues Solicitation W52P1J-22-Q-3032 for the procurement Steel Rope Wire 155MM, Suspension Wire 60MM, Suspension Wire 6? (81MM) and Suspension Wire 29.125? (81MM). This solicitation will result in a 5 year Firm-Fixed Price Indefinite Delivery, Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract. This solicitation is issued in accordance with FAR 12 (Acquisition of Commercial Items) and FAR Part 13 (Simplified Acquisition Procedures). The U.S. Government will evaluate quotes based on the responsive, responsible offer who has the lowest Total Evaluated Price, and any other price related factors required by the solicitation. See attachments for further details. *** Attachment 0002 - Drawing 9251603 - REV D dated 23 June 2014, Attachment 0003 - Drawing 9381073 REV J dated 23 Jan 1995, Attachment 0004 - Drawing 12630573 REV B dated 13 Feb 1991, and Attachment 0005 - Drawing 12630653 REV B dated 26 Dec 2000 for this requirement are restricted and are available by requesting access via SAM.gov. The vendor shall select the link of the drawing and complete the necessary information requested to gain access. The vendor?s Data Custodian MUST be the POC requesting access. For additional information on how to gain access to the restricted drawing please visit the following website: https://dodprocurementtoolbox.com/site-pages/contract-opportunities

description: NOTICE BOROUGH OF BEAR CREEK VILLAGE PO BOX 332 BEAR CREEK PA, 18602 BEAR CREEK VILLAGE GUIDE RAIL PROJECT - REBID INTERSECTION OF SR 0115, SR 2041 AND BEAUPLAND RD. BEAR CREEK VILLAGE, LUZERNE COUNTY ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS Sealed Bids for the construction of the Bear Creek Village Guide Rail Project - REBID will be received online via the PennBid Program, by the Borough of Bear Creek Village, until 11:00 a.m. local time on May 16, 2022, at which time the Bids received will be opened electronically and publicly posted on PennBid's website. The Project consists of the addition of a new guide rail along Beaupland Road. Bids will be received for a single prime Contract. Bids shall be on a lump sum basis as indicated in the Bid Form. All bidding documents are available at no cost at https://pennbid.procureware.com. A pre-bid conference will not be held for this project. Bid security shall be furnished in accordance with the Instructions to Bidders. The following wage rate requirements are applicable to this contract: PA Prevailing Wage Rates. Bidder must ensure that employees and applicants for employment are not discriminated against because of their race, religion, color, handicap, national origin, age or sex. The Borough of Bear Creek Village does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, disability, or familial status in employment or the provision of services. The Borough of Bear Creek Village is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

title: RFQ - Architectural/Engineering Services
description:
Open RFQ  Architectural/Engineering Services
Thank you for your interest in the A/E Services RFQ. There is no specific RFQ document for this
solicitation. We keep this request on our website at all times because we regularly accept submissions
for A/E services to add to our files in the City of Knoxville Purchasing Division. Professional services
providers are encouraged to submit their statements of qualifications, resumes, company brochures,
letters of reference, etc. to the Purchasing Division where they are made available to the various
departments. When a department begins planning a project that may require professional A/E Services,
the departments have the option to come to the Purchasing Division and review the A/E submittals and
then contact an individual or company they feel may be able to assist in the project.
Submissions may be mailed to:
City of Knoxville, Purchasing Department
C/O A/E Services
400 Main Street, Suite 667
Knoxville TN 37902
Or submissions may be emailed to:
citypurchasing@knoxvilletn.gov

Status: Open
IFB 7602-1

Department of Military Affairs -Department of Military Affairs
Building 316
Fort Pickett
Blackstone VA
Work locations will vary as listed in IFB

The intent and purpose of this Invitation for Bid (IFB) is to establish contracts with five or more qualified contractors per eVA zone who can provide Fencing and Barriers. Each will include repairs, maintenance, enhancements and new installation on an as needed basis at various National Guard facilities throughout the state of Virginia for a period of one (1) year with the option to renew for four (4) additional one-year periods for the Department of Military Affairs, an agency of the Commonwealth of Virginia, hereinafter referred to as DMA or The Agency.
Contractors have the option to submit bids for any or all of the Services in any or all eVA zones in which the Term Contractor is capable of completing.
Current Facility names and locations are listed in Appendices III and IV of this solicitation; contract includes but is not limited to these locations. DMA reserves the right, at any time during the term of this contract, to add or delete additional facilities and/or services that fall within the scope of this contract

title: Sources Sought- Elevator Rehab
description: REQUEST FOR INFORMATION The Government is issuing this Request for Information to determine a competitive basis for the procurement described. This is not a solicitation. No reimbursement will be made for any costs associated with providing information in response to this survey. This survey is for market research purposes only.? Only contractors capable of performing this type of work should respond to this Request for Information. Requirement The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), Nashville District, anticipates a requirement for a firm fixed-price construction contract for Elevator Rehabilitation at Wilson Lock and Dam in Florence, Alabama. The estimated magnitude of this project is between $250,000 and $500,000. In the scope of this contract, the Contractor shall be required to provide all material, labor, tools, and equipment necessary to remove the existing elevator components and replace/upgrade with newer components to meet current AL State qualifications, ADA and the American National Standard Safety codes for elevators, dumbwaiters, escalators and moving walks. Types of tasks may include (but are not limited to): -Replacing Elevator Control System (including free fall braking system, main drive motor, main motor mechanical stop, ribbon cables, push buttons, etc.) -Integrating new Fire Alarm system into phone system for automatic emergency response The Contractor will be required to provide all plant, labor, and materials to complete the project. The anticipated NAICS code is 238290- Other Building Equipment Contractors, with a size standard of $16.5 million. Survey The Government is issuing this notice to determine a competitive basis. This is not a solicitation and the items listed herein are subject to change or eliminated from the requirement. This survey is for market research purposes only. Only Contractors capable of performing this type of work should respond to this Request for Information. Your response to this survey is requested?by 5:00 PM Central Time, May 23, 2022.?Please send via email to Alison Abernathy at Alison.T.Abernathy@usace.army.mil Name of your firm: CAGE: Point of Contact, Phone number, and Email address: Please provide responses to the following: List three (3) projects completed within ten (10) years of the date of this notice that demonstrates experience, as a prime contractor or subcontractor, removing and replacing elevator components as described in the above? 1. Project Name: Contract Number (if applicable): Year completed: Prime or Subcontractor: Type and percentage of work self-performed (based on contract value): Dollar Amount: General Description of project: 2. Project Name: Contract Number (if applicable): Year completed: Prime or Subcontractor: Type and percentage of work self-performed (based on contract value): Dollar Amount: General Description of project: 3. Project Name: Contract Number (if applicable): Year completed: Prime or Subcontractor: Type and percentage of work self-performed (based on contract value): Dollar Amount: General Description of project: 5. Are you a Small Business classified under the above NAICS code? If so, do you fall into a sub-category (e.g., Hubzone, 8(a), SDVOSB, WOSB, etc.)? 6. For this requirement, what percentage of this work would you subcontract (reference FAR 52.219-14, Limitations on Subcontracting, Class Deviation 2019-O0003)? 7. Do you plan to subcontract to only small businesses? 8. If the answer to question 7 is ?yes?, are these small businesses with a sub-category (e.g., HubZone, 8(a), SDVOSB, WOSB, etc.)? 9. What is your bonding capacity per contract? 10. What is your aggregate bonding capacity per contract? 11. If this requirement is advertised, do you anticipate submitting a bid? 12. Please provide any additional information you feel is necessary
