description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is DPW2129002 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 333244 with a small business size standard of 750.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-05-16 12:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Fort Drum, NY 13602 The MICC End User requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following: LI 001: XPJ-1682SR 64" dual head eco-solvent printer with take-up, 2, EA; LI 002: installation/training, 3, DAY; LI 003: Freight to Fort Drum NY, 1, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. This is currently an unfunded requirement with a high expectation that funds will be available. When and if funds become available a contract will be awarded at that time. The offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions: FAR 52.252-1, Solicitation. Provisions Incorporated by Reference; FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications; FAR 52.211-6, Brand name or Equal. The following clauses apply to this solicitation: FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions ? Commercial Items. However, you may also file a protest to the Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 35 calendar days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. Headquarters U.S. Army Materiel Command Office of Command Counsel-Deputy Command Counsel 4400 Martin Road Rm: A6SE040.001 Redstone Arsenal, AL 35898-5000 Fax: (256) 450-8840 or email usarmy.redstone.usamc.mbx.protests@mail.mil The AMC-Level Protest procedures are found at: https://www.amc.army.mil/Connect/Legal-Resources/. If internet access is not available, contact the contracting officer or HQ, AMC to obtain the HQ AMC-Level Protest Procedures. category_id: Equipment: Appliances, Service and Trade Equipment Bids
title: New Steam Vault
description: INVITATION TO BID ? CLARION UNIVERSITY of PENNSYLVANIA CL-833: GIVAN HALL NEW STEAM VAULT PROJECT Clarion University of the PA State System of Higher Education invites Contractors to download bid documents for this project. The project scope consists of demolishing the existing concrete vault structure and replace in-kind. The new vault concrete will have a crystalline waterproofing admixture to limit water infiltration and prolong the life of the structure. The top of the vault will be covered with a new waterproofing membrane. The new vault will be accessed by a new 36?X36? aluminum hatch door. All steam pipe within the vault, and 6? beyond the vault perimeter will also be replaced in kind. Steam pipe outside the vault will be direct-burry type pipe. All steam valves, traps, and miscellaneous items within the vault will be replaced in-kind. Pipe insulation within the vault will be pyrogel type insulation. Work shall be accomplished by a Separate Prime Contractors according to Pennsylvania statute. The Lead Prime Contractor shall be the General Construction Contractor and shall include, but is not necessarily limited to, the furnishing of all labor, superintendence, materials, tools and equipment and performing all work necessary to complete all construction identified on the Contract Documents to the satisfaction of, and subject to approval of the Professional and the University. A mandatory Pre-bid conference, with site visit to follow, will be held on May 5, 2022, at 10:00 AM in the McEntire Building, Conference Room 127, on the campus of Clarion University of PA. located in Clarion, PA 16214. Electronic Bids are due no later than 2:00 PM, EST on May 24, 2022, through PASSHE?s ARIBA Sourcepoint located at http://seller.ariba.com. The Bid package is available at http://seller.ariba.com. In order to submit a proposal, interested bidders need to register at PASSHE?s ARIBA Sourcepoint http://seller.ariba.com. Registration is a free process that takes only a few minutes. Once registered, bidders may obtain all solicitation documents, receive notification of solicitation updates, and submit and update their confidential bids online. PASSHE?s eProcurement Exchange provides bid privacy, security and supplier confidentiality, while streamlining the overall procurement process. Although all solicitations are available for public viewing, interested suppliers need to register to be able to submit a bid. Directions: https://www.clarion.edu/about-clarion/campus-maps/index.html

category_id: Equipment: Appliances, Service and Trade Equipment Bids
title: Industrial Sewing Machines and Parts ITQ
description: The Department of Corrections (DOC) is soliciting Suppliers to submit qualifications for the Industrial Sewing Machines and Parts Invitation to Qualify (ITQ). Those Suppliers that meet the qualifications will be awarded a contract and will be eligible to respond to Request for Quotes (RFQ) for Industrial Sewing Machines and parts to the DOC. Please go to https://www.dgs.pa.gov/Materials-Services-Procurement/Procurement-Resources/Pages/ITQ-Documents.aspx to view a list of ITQ Contracts and related documents. First, suppliers must register as a PA Supplier and receive a vendor number. Suppliers will register in the PA Supplier Portal at https://pasupplierportal.state.pa.us/irj/portal/anonymous. Lastly, suppliers are required to create a user profile within our JAGGAER portal to complete qualification requirements. To access the JAGGAER portal: https://solutions.sciquest.com/apps/Router/SupplierLogin?CustOrg=CommonwealthPA. QUALIFICATIONS WILL ONLY BE ACCEPTED ELECTRONICALLY THROUGH JAGGAER. Technical support is available via Jaggaer at JAGGAER Support or by calling (800) 233-1121.

category_id: Equipment: Appliances, Service and Trade Equipment Bids
title: Ultrasonic Clothes Dryer Technology Licensing Opportunity
description: UT-Battelle, LLC, acting under its Prime Contract No. DE-AC05-00OR22725 with the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) for the management and operation of the Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL), is seeking commercialization partners for its ultrasonic dryer technology. The ORNL Technology Transfer Office will accept license applications through May 19, 2022. Researchers at ORNL have developed an innovative ultrasonic drying technology using low-energy piezoelectric transducers to produce high-frequency vibrations to mechanically remove water from a variety of materials quickly and three times more efficiently than thermal drying (US Patent 10,520,252). This particular implementation of the technology is applied to clothes dryers. The technology utilizes ultrasound transducers to create a high frequency mechanical oscillation on the surface of the article subjected to drying or atomizing. More information can be found at this ORNL Technology Transfer webpage. License applications will be evaluated based on prospective partners' ability and commitment to successfully commercialize the technology, with a preference for United States-based businesses and small businesses. For additional information and license application, contact Andreana Leskovjan, Commercialization Manager, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, leskovjanac@ornl.gov, 865-341-0433.

title: Large Equipment for Child Nutrition
description:
Large Equipment for Child Nutrition
Solicitation ID: 024-22
Status: Posted
Contact Name: Tiffany Mullins
Contact Number: 817-547-5632
Contact Email: tiffany.mullins@birdvilleschools.net
Response Due Time: 2:00 PM
Response Due Date: 5/25/2022
Agency/Texas SmartBuy Member Number: S2201
Solicitation Description:
PURPOSE
In order to be in compliance with federal, state and local purchasing laws, the Birdville Independent School District (BISD) is soliciting competitive sealed proposals for large equipment for the child nutrition department. This contract is for multiple locations across the district. Based on the price cost analysis, the estimated contract for this purchase is $51,370.

CONTRACT TERM AND RENEWALS
This proposal shall be effective from board approval through completion of installation. All units must be delivered and installed no later than October 11, 2022.

PROPOSAL SUBMISSION
Late proposals will not be accepted. No verbal, telophonic, electronic mail or faxed responses will be considered. The preferred method of delivery is through the e-bid system; however, paper responses will be accepted in the Purchasing Department prior to the due date and time. To receive a paper version, please contact Purchasing via phone 817-547-5629 or by email bisd.purchasing@birdvilleschools.net.

category_id: Equipment: Appliances, Service and Trade Equipment Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): 73--Food Service Equipment Building Olympic Dining Facility JBLM
description: AMENDMENT NOTICE: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is JBLMFPMO20220003 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 333318 with a small business size standard of 1,000.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified offerors may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-05-13 12:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Joint Base Lewis-McChord, WA 98433 The MICC End User requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following: LI 001: Deep Fat Fryer, Electric with 2 split pots, 2 Full Pots, and Automatic Top-Off. 208V, 3 Phase, 68 kW (Hard-wired), similar or equal to Pitco Model:SELV14C2/14T2FDA Solstice 120 lb with Built in Filtration System. Overall dimensions: Left to Right: 62 1/2" Front to Back: 34 3/8" Height: 45 3/4" Frying Area (per split pot): 6 5/16" x 14 13/16" Frying Area (per full pot): 13 1/2" x 14 13/16" Shall include swivel Casters, 1, EA; LI 002: 2 EA extra fryer basket for split pot and 1 EA extra fryer basket for full Pot, compatible with line item #1 above, 3, EA; LI 003: 30" Fryer Clean out rod for use with Line item #1, 1, EA; LI 004: Stainless Steel cover for use with Line item #1, 2, EA; LI 005: Shipping to JBLM, WA, 1, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested offerors must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerors that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerors may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should offerors require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. This is currently an unfunded requirement with a high expectation that funds will be available. When and if funds become available a contract will be awarded at that time. The offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions: FAR 52.252-1, Solicitation. Provisions Incorporated by Reference; FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications; FAR 52.211-6, Brand name or Equal. The following clauses apply to this solicitation: FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions ? Commercial Items. The following FAR clauses in paragraph (b) of FAR clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, apply: 52.204-10, Reporting Executive Compensation and First Tier Subcontract Awards; 52.219-6, Notice of Total Small Business Set-Aside; 52.219-28, Post Award Small Business Program Rerepresentation; 52.222-3, Convict Labor; 52.222-19, Child Labor-Cooperation with Authorities and Remedies; 52.222-21, Prohibition of Segregated Facilities; 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities; 52.225-13, Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases; 52.232-33, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer--System for Award Management. 52.233-4, Applicable Law for Breach of Contract Claim; The following DFARS clauses apply: DFARS 252.04-7004, Alternate A System for Award Management; 252.211-7003, Item Identification and Valuation; 252.225-7002, Qualifying Country Sources as Subcontractors; 252.232-7010, Levies on Contract Payments; 252.203-7000, Requirements Relating to Compensation of Former DoD Officials; 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance Of Payments Program; 252.225-7036, Buy American Act -- Free Trade Agreements -- Balance of Payments Program; 252.232-7003, Electronic Submission of Payment Requests; 252.247-7023, Primary and ALT III, Transportation of Supplies by Sea. IAW 52.204-7 System for Award Management (SAM) Registration (July 2013), the offeror must be registered in SAM and fully input their Representations and Certifications for a complete record. Information can be found at http://www.sam.gov or by calling 866-606-8220, or 334-206-7828 for international calls. 52.204-13 - System for Award Management Maintenance Shipping is FOB Destination CONUS (CONtinental U.S.). New Equipment ONLY. NO USED OR REMANUFACTURED PRODUCTS WILL BE ACCEPTED. Submitted Quotes will be valid for 45 days after the auction closing. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ), not an invitation for bid (IFB).). IAW FAR 52.252-2 Clauses Incorporated by Reference, for the extended description here is the website: https://www.acquisition.gov/ The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement can be found. The small business size standard for that NAICS code can be found at https://www.sba.gov/sites/default/files/files/Size_Standards_Table.pdf 5152.233-4000 AMC-LEVEL PROTEST PROGRAM (Feb 2014) (LOCAL CLAUSE) Prior to submitting an agency protest, it is preferable that you first attempt to resolve your concerns with the responsible contracting officer (Phone: (315)772-7272 or Email: usarmy.drum.acc-micc.mbx.micc@mail.mil). However, you may also file a protest to the Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 35 calendar days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. description: AMENDMENT NOTICE: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is JBLMFPMO20220004 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 333318 with a small business size standard of 1,000.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified offerors may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-05-13 12:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Joint Base Lewis-McChord, WA 98433 The MICC End User requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following: LI 001: The Buy American Act form(s) included in the buy must be returned with your quote. Failure to return the form(s) with your quote will result in your quote not being considered for award., 1, EA; LI 002: Double Deck Electric convection oven similar to Vulcan VC44ED-308 208V 60 Hz 120 Amps as 1 Phase or 70 Amps as 3 Phase. Equipped with 2 locking casters and 2 non-locking casters. Hird-wired connection Stainless Steel Brush exterior finish 70"H x 45"D X 40-1/4" D, 2, EA; LI 003: Stainless Steel 5-well electric Steam Table 208/240V, rated at 4,125-5,500 Watts, enclosed base, single sided service with food/Sneeze guards and top shelf 19.85-22.9 AMPS 60 Hz 1 phase. Equipped with Casters, NSF Listed Similar to Advanced Tabco model SW-5E-240-BS, 2, EA; LI 004: Stainless Steel 4-well electric Steam Table 208/240V, rated at 4,125-5,500 Watts, enclosed base, single sided service with food/Sneeze guards and top shelf 14.42-16.67 AMPS 60 Hz 1 phase. Equipped with Casters NSF Listed Similar to Advanced Tabco model HF-4E-240-BS, 2, EA; LI 005: Heavy Duty Electric Range with 2 All-Purpose top sections and Standard Oven, similar to Garland Model 36ER36 208V, 1 Phase, 18.5kW, 60Hz Hardwired connection. 37"H x 36"W x 36"D, 4, EA; LI 006: Heavy Duty Commercial Blenders, Similar to Vita-Mix, professional series 750, 4, EA; LI 007: Heavy Duty Food Processor similar to Robot Coupe food processor model CL52E, 1, EA; LI 008: Shipping, 1, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested offerors must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerors that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerors that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerors that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerors may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should offerors require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. This is currently an unfunded requirement with a high expectation that funds will be available. When and if funds become available a contract will be awarded at that time. Questions shall be submitted to joseph.pishioneri@bep.gov.? ?? Aside from the attached Statement of Work, attachments are not included in this posting.? To obtain the attachments, potential offerors must submit capabilities to Joseph Pishioneri at joseph.pishioneri@bep.gov and request access to the attachments.? Written responses to this notice shall contain sufficient documentation to establish a bona fide capability to fulfill this requirement. Once the offeror?s capabilities are determined bona-fide by the Government, a non-disclosure agreement (NDA) will be provided by the contracting officer.? When the offeror signs and returns the NDA, the attachments will be provided.? A determination by the Government not to provide the attachments for this proposed requirement based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government.

title: 6632--600 STRESS EXERCISE MONITORING SYSTEM-e_BIKE
description: DISCLAIMER This RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes only and does not constitute a solicitation. All information received in response to this RFI that is marked as proprietary will be handled accordingly. IAW FAR 15.201(e), responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. Responders are solely responsible for all expenses associated with responding to this RFI. SOURCES-SOUGHT DESCRIPTION This is NOT a solicitation announcement. This is a sources-sought/RFI only. The purpose of this sources-sought/RFI is to gain knowledge of potential qualified sources and their size classification relative to NAICS 339920 (size standard of 750 Employees). Responses to this sources-sought will be used by the Government to make appropriate acquisition decisions. After review of the responses to this sources-sought, a solicitation announcement may be published. Responses to this sources-sought synopsis are not considered adequate responses for a solicitation announcement. Responses to this notice shall include the following: (a) company name (b) address (c) point of contact (d) phone, fax, and email (e) DUNS number (f) Cage Code (g) Tax ID Number (h) Type of Large or small business, e.g. Services Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business, Veteran- owned small business (i) Must provide a capability statement that addresses the organizations qualifications and ability to perform as a contractor for the products/ work described below. Qualifications shall include annotation if company is manufacturer or authorize distributor. Authorized distributors shall include verifiable statements from the manufacturer of status as a distributor and the ability to complete any work required to honor warranty work. The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), VISN 22 Network Contracting Office, is seeking Brand name or equal and compatible GE HealthCare eBike for Stress Echocardiograms that meets the following salient characteristics for the Loma Linda VA Healthcare System: SALIENT CHARACTERISTICS/TECHNICAL REQUIREMENT GE HealthCare eBike for Stress Echocardiograms in Cardiology service The Long Beach VHA requires a GE HealthCare eBike for Stress Echocardiograms in Cardiology Service. This eBike is to provide a stable exercise platform ensuring patient safety and comfort during Echo Stress testing; it must be ergonomically designed to fit all cardiac patients. VHALB requires that it: Provides stable and comfortable patient positioning for stress-echo procedure Provides a stress-testing mechanism for patients with limited mobility or who have trouble walking. Must feature a stable exercise platform that helps reduce upper body motion for less muscle artifact. Offers reduced system noise which provides less interference with manual blood pressure acquisition Provides defined workload at end of all test protocols. Supports both standard and customizable exercise protocols. Must enable ultrasound image acquisition without moving patient from exercise platform. Patient can transition to recovery phase directly on exercise platform. Require side drop-out for full access to the imaging region. Must provide electronic vertical and horizontal rotation adjustability that supports proper positioning of the heart for the echo portion of the procedure. Must operate on either 110 or 220V and 50-60 Hz. Must have fully motor driven controls for tilt from a flat position to a 45-degree angle. Must have fully cushioned head support. Must have preset protocols and user entry protocol options. Must offer Interface to current ECG Stress System.

Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, National Guard - Pennsylvania intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. National Guard - Pennsylvania is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. This solicitation requires registration with the System for Award Management (SAM) prior to award, pursuant to applicable regulations and guidelines. Registration information can be found at www.sam.gov. The selected Offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions, which are incorporated herein by reference: FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition; FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items - the selected offeror must submit a completed copy of the listed representations and certifications; FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items; FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, paragraph (a) and the following clauses in paragraph (b): 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-35, 52.222-36, 52.222-37, 52.225-13, 52.232-34. The full text of the referenced FAR clauses may be accessed electronically at https://www.acquisition.gov/far/. IAW FAR 52.212-2; Evaluation - Commercial Items, the following factor shall be used to evaluate offers: Technical capability of the item offered to meet the Government requirement and price. IAW 52.204-7 System for Award Management (SAM) Registration (July 2013), the offeror must be registered in SAM and fully input their Representations and Certifications for a complete record. Information can be found at http://www.sam.gov or by calling 866-606-8220, or 334-206-7828 for international calls. 52.204-13 - System for Award Management Maintenance Shipping is FOB Destination CONUS (Continental U.S.). No multiple awards will be made. Quotes received through Unison Marketplace will be evaluated and awarded on an ?all-or-nothing? basis. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ), not an invitation for bid (IFB).). The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement can be found. title: Playground Swings & Surfacing
description:
The Town of Stratford is seeking competitive bids from qualified contractors with proven industry experience, to provide labor, materials, tools, equipment, and all else necessary, to furnish and install playground swings and surfacing per the scope of work. Awarded contractor will be responsible for removal and proper disposal of existing equipment. Attention is called to the fact that this program is being funded through the Federal Community Development Block Grant Program and, as such, not less than the minimum salaries and wages, as set forth in the Bid Documents, must be paid on this project. Please note that the project is subject to Federal prevailing wage rates and all applicable requirements. All bidders must certify that they are eligible to bid on the project, and that they are not excluded from Federal Procurement or Non-Procurement Programs. An Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Minority/Womens Business Enterprises are encouraged to apply.
Start Date: May 05, 2022
End Date: Jun 02, 2022

Philip Ryan

2725 Main Street Stratford CT, 06615 United States

Tel: pryan@townofstratford.com

Fax: pryan@townofstratford.com

category_id: Equipment: Athletic, Exercise, Playground, Parks and Recreation Bids
title: Engagement Center Equipment and Services
description: Pursuant to the State Purchasing Act (Official Code of Georgia Annotated 50-5-50 et seq.), the University of Georgia is issuing this Request for Quote (RFQ) to accept bids for UGA's Development and Alumni Relations Engagement Center equipment and services per the attached Bid Specifications. Pricing must include all applicable costs for products or services, including any applicable shipping charges FOB Destination to Athens, Georgia , and all other requirements as outlined in the Specifications. All questions must be submitted to the Procurement Office via the Questions function on this solicitation. Prospective bidders should only contact the University of Georgia Procurement Office regarding this solicitation. This solicitation is to establish an agency contract for the University of Georgia. The initial term of the contract and any renewal options shall be in accordance with the Agency Contract Cover Sheet. Single Award: Any contract award resulting from the RFQ will be made to the lowest, responsive and responsible supplier meeting all specifications and with whom the University of Georgia has reached agreement on all contract terms and conditions.

category_id: Equipment: Athletic, Exercise, Playground, Parks and Recreation Bids
title: Playground Equipment
description: Project Scope and Requirements Design two or three separate playground areas for student use in grades Kindergarten - 2. ? Each playground should include;  A playscape with slides, climbing wall/bridge, steps, and shade structure  Arch swings suitable for 8 or more children at a time  Multiple stand alone structures such as a spring rider, climbing dome, tunnel, mushrooms, balance beam, benches etc ..  Low maintenance surfacing options suited for the designated fall height and fall zone of the equipement. ? There may be some equipment that can be transferred from the existing K-1 Primary school to Beaverdam Elementary. o Design one adaptive play area. ? Play area should include  A variety of equipment suitable for K-2 students with disabilities.  This area will have a concrete base and low pile turf installed by our construction management team.

category_id: Equipment: Athletic, Exercise, Playground, Parks and Recreation Bids

category_id: Equipment: Athletic, Exercise, Playground, Parks and Recreation Bids
title: Playground Replacement Project
description:
Notice is hereby given that sealed bids will be received:

By: Portage Township Schools, 6240 US-6, Portage, IN 46368

For: Portage Township Schools - South Haven Playground Replacement Project, 395 Midway Dr, Valparaiso, IN 46385

At: Portage Township Schools  Administration Office, 6240 US-6

Portage, IN 46368

Until: 10:00AM (CST) on June 1, 2022

Bid Opening: Bids will be received until 10:00AM (CST) on June 1, 2022, at the Portage Township Schools  Administration Building located at 6240 US-6, Portage, IN 46368

All work for the complete construction of the Project will be under one or more prime contracts with the Owner based on bids received and on combinations awarded. The Construction Manager will manage the construction of the Project.

Construction shall be in full accordance with the Bidding Documents which are on file with the Owner and may be examined by prospective bidders at the following locations:

Office of the Construction Manager

The Skillman Corporation

8006 Aetna Street

Merrillville, IN 46410

The Skillman Plan Room

www.skillmanplanroom.com

Prime and Non-Prime Contract Bidders must place an order on www.skillmanplanroom.com to be able to download documents electronically or request printed documents. There is no cost for downloading the bidding documents. Bidders desiring printed documents shall pay for the cost of printing, shipping, and handling. Reprographic Services are provided by:

Reprographic Arts, 2824 E. Michigan Blvd., Michigan City, IN 46360, Phone (219) 872-9111

Bid security in the amount of ten percent (10%) of the Bid must accompany each Bid in accordance with the Instructions to Bidders.

The successful Bidders will be required to furnish Performance and Payment Bonds for one hundred percent (100%) of their Contract amount prior to execution of Contracts.

Contractors submitting bids for the performance of any Work as specified in this building Project should make such Bids to Portage Township Schools. Contractors are advised that the Contract as finally entered into with any successful Bidder may be entered into with either the School Corporation or the Building Corporation or certain portions of the Contract may be entered into by both the School Corporation and the Building Corporation.

The Owner reserves the right to accept or reject any Bid (or combination of Bids) and to waive any irregularities in bidding. All Bids may be held for a period not to exceed 60 days before awarding contracts.

Portage Township Schools

By: Mrs. Amanda K. P. Alaniz, Ed. D - Superintendent

category_id: Equipment: Athletic, Exercise, Playground, Parks and Recreation Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): NYARNG Life Support Tentage and HVAC Services at Ft. Drum NY
description: The New York Army National Guard USP&FO NY has a requirement for temporary sleeping quarters for 250 Soldiers in accordance with this Performance Work Statement. The vendor shall provide set up of 8,000 sq/ft of tentage, 250 cots, flooring, lighting, necessary power generations, and HVAC of tentage. This tentage will be required to be set up at the O?Brian Readiness Training Center located outside of Fort Drum Main Post. The solicitation is issued as a total (100%) small-business set aside and will result in a Firm-Fixed-Price purchase order. Award will be made to the lowest responsible offer that can meet all aspects of the RFQ and is registered as a small business in www.sam.gov. Vendors must provide a quote for ALL items required. Partial quotes will not be considered. Quotes are due 16MAY2022 10:00 via email to melissa.santoro2.civ@army.mil . System of Award Management (https://www.SAM.gov) registration is required pursuant to FAR provision 5.207, and prospective offerors are encouraged to register prior to the submittal of quotations. 52.204-26 MUST be included with the quote, if not in sam.gov registration. In order to be eligible for award, the successful offeror's System for Award Management (SAM) (https://www.sam.gov) registration must be active and includes representations and certifications. The solicitation and all amendments are on www.Sam.Gov Contracting Opportunities. Caution: This solicitation will be issued electronically as will any amendments thereto. Because of this, the Government is under no obligation and is in fact unable to maintain a bidder's mailing list. It is therefore incumbent upon any interested parties to periodically access the website in order to obtain any amendments which may be issued. Failure to obtain any said amendments and to respond to them prior to the date and time set for receipt of proposals may render your proposal nonresponsive and result in rejection of same.

title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) 78--Aqua-Xtreme Mesh
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is 1-10650649 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 339920 with a small business size standard of 750.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-05-23 13:30:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be FT Hood, TX 76544 The MICC End User requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following: LI 001: Custom loop-loc Pool cover 84'X60' with hard wear. (Hunter Green), 1, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. This is currently an unfunded requirement with a high expectation that funds will be available. When and if funds become available a contract will be awarded at that time. The offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions: FAR 52.252-1, Solicitation. Provisions Incorporated by Reference; FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications; FAR 52.211-6, Brand name or Equal. The following clauses apply to this solicitation: FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions ? Commercial Items. The following FAR clauses in paragraph (b) of FAR clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, apply: 52.204-10, Reporting Executive Compensation and First Tier Subcontract Awards; 52.219-6, Notice of Total Small Business Set-Aside; 52.219-28, Post Award Small Business Program Rerepresentation; 52.222-3, Convict Labor; 52.222-19, Child Labor-Cooperation with Authorities and Remedies; 52.222-21, Prohibition of Segregated Facilities; 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities; 52.225-13, Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases; 52.232-33, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer--System for Award Management. 52.233-4, Applicable Law for Breach of Contract Claim; The following DFARS clauses apply: DFARS 252.04-7004, Alternate A System for Award Management; 252.211-7003, Item Identification and Valuation; 252.225-7002, Qualifying Country Sources as Subcontractors; 252.232-7010, Levies on Contract Payments; 252.203-7000, Requirements Relating to Compensation of Former DoD Officials; 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance Of Payments Program; 252.225-7036, Buy American Act -- Free Trade Agreements -- Balance of Payments Program; 252.232-7003, Electronic Submission of Payment Requests; 252.247-7023, Primary and ALT III, Transportation of Supplies by Sea. IAW 52.204-7 System for Award Management (SAM) Registration (July 2013), the offeror must be registered in SAM and fully input their Representations and Certifications for a complete record. Information can be found at http://www.sam.gov or by calling 866-606-8220, or 334-206-7828 for international calls. 52.204-13 - System for Award Management Maintenance Shipping is FOB Destination CONUS (CONtinental U.S.). New Equipment ONLY. NO USED OR REMANUFACTURED PRODUCTS WILL BE ACCEPTED. Submitted Quotes will be valid for 45 days after the auction closing. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ), not an invitation for bid (IFB).). IAW FAR 52.252-2 Clauses Incorporated by Reference, for the extended description here is the website: https://www.acquisition.gov/ The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement can be found. The small business size standard for that NAICS code can be found at https://www.sba.gov/sites/default/files/files/Size_Standards_Table.pdf 5152.233-4000 AMC-LEVEL PROTEST PROGRAM (Feb 2014) (LOCAL CLAUSE) Prior to submitting an agency protest, it is preferable that you first attempt to resolve your concerns with the responsible contracting officer (Phone: (315)772-7272 or Email: usarmy.drum.acc-micc.mbx.micc@mail.mil). However, you may also file a protest to the Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 35 calendar days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. category_id: Equipment: Boat and Marine Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) USS PORTLAND (LPD-27) Timing Gear Assembly
description: This is a sources sought announcement in anticipation of a potential future procurement. Southwest Regional Maintenance Center (SWRMC) is conducting market research seeking to identify sources with the ability to provide Timing Gear Assembly replacement parts on the USS PORTLAND (LPD-27)?anticipated to begin in December 2022 (subject to change).? The Government seeks authorized distributors of original equipment manufacturer that can provide material in compliance with the attached Product Description. SWRMC is especially interested in determining small business capability and interest. The anticipated Request for Quote (RFQ) release date is on or around 17 May 2022. SWRMC is contemplating award of a firm fixed price contract. The applicable NAICS is 336612. What/Where to Submit: Interested companies should submit a notice of interest including the name, telephone number, mailing address, and e-mail address of one point of contact. Please email your interest to Contracting Officer Cynthia Urias (cynthia.urias@navy.mil) and Contract Specialists Jordan Trujillo (jordan.r.trujillo@gmail.com) with "SWRMC USS PORTLAND (LPD-27) TIMING GEAR ASSY. ? SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE". The notice of interest should include a brief description of your company, its capabilities in response to the bullets identified above, additional capabilities as they relate to the requirements set forth herein, and answers to the following specific questions. Please limit your response to no more than 10 (ten) pages. 1. Is your company an authorized distributor of the OEM?? 2. Is your company a small or large business as defined by the Small Business Administration (SBA) under NAICS code 336612(the small business size standard is 1,000 in number of employees)? If small business please specify (small, 8(a), women-owned, HUBZone, veteran-owned, or service-disabled veteran-owned) [more than one category may be selected as applicable] 3. Does your company have a website? If so, what is your company's website address? 4. Does your company have a satisfactory performance record for the type of product and service desired? Please provide examples. 5. Is your company able to provide material, as required within the Product Description? 6. Based on the Product Description in this announcement, does your company plan to submit a proposal in response to the anticipated solicitation for the SWRMC USS PORTLAND (LPD-27) TIMING GEAR ASSY. ? SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE requirement? Information provided shall be treated as Business Sensitive or Confidential to the responder, exempt from public release under the Freedom of Information Act. All information shall be provided free of charge to the Government. SWRMC may request further information regarding the capabilities of respondents to may request further information regarding the capabilities of respondents to meet the requirements set forth in the announcement. This sources sought announcement is not a request for proposal. The purpose of this sources sought announcement is to gather information from the market place. Information provided in response to this sources sought announcement will not be considered an offer by the responding contractor and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. No telephone inquiries will be accepted and requests for solicitation packages will not be granted, as a solicitation has not been prepared at this time. When to Submit: Responses are requested no later than 11AM local time, San Diego, CA on 17 May 2022. Notice Regarding Sources Sought: Please note that this sources sought is for information purposes and to identify potential sources. This notice does not constitute an RFQ, Invitation for Bid, or Request for Proposal, and is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government of any kind. Other: The Government will not pay for any effort expended or any material provided in response to this announcement or any follow up information requests, nor will the Government return any data provided. Future information, if any, will be posted at the SAM.gov website. Contracting Office Address: NAVSEA Southwest Regional Maintenance Center 3755 Brinser Street, Suite 1 San Diego, CA 92136-5299 Point of Contacts: Cynthia Urias - cynthia.urias@navy.mil Jordan Trujillo - jordan.r.trujillo@navy.mil

title: Bids for Boat Yardwork, Maintenance & Repair
description:
The City of San Diego (City) Public Utilities Departments Environmental Monitoring and Technical Services Division (Division) conducts the Ocean Monitoring program mandated by the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Permit for the purpose of studying the effect of the Citys regional treatment processes on the marine environment. The Division utilizes two monitoring vessels to conduct sampling in the ocean environment to determine its ecological health and to identify potential health concerns associated with the recreational use of San Diegos coastline. The Division requires general yardwork and preventive maintenance for the vessels, including but not limited to electrical, hydraulic, and mechanical systems, repair of engines and generators, and replacing main winch spools as needed.

category_id: Equipment: Boat and Marine Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) 2040 - Procurement of Mafo Naval Enclosure Quick-Acting Watertight Door
description: This is a Sources Sought Notice (SS) for Market Research Only. NAVSUP Fleet Logistics Center is issuing this SS Notice to determine the availability of potential sources for Mafo Naval Enclosure, Quick-Acting Watertight Door, Part Number C9402023, at Southeast Regional Maintenance Center (SERMC), Mayport, FL. As part of its market research, Naval Supply Systems Command (NAVSUP) Fleet Logistics Center Jacksonville (FLCJ) is issuing this notice to determine the availability of contractors capable of fulfilling the Government?s requirements. The Government may use the responses to this notice for information and planning purposes. The material description describes only the currently contemplated possible scope of supply and may vary from the work scope in a final DOR included in any Request for Quotes (RFQ). This notice does not constitute a request for proposal, request for quote or invitation to bid. The intent of this notice is to identify potential offerors for market research purposes and to determine whether to set-aside the requirement for SMALL BUSINESS. A firm-fixed price contract is anticipated. Offerors possessing the requisite skills, resources and capabilities necessary to perform the stated requirement are invited to respond to this notice via the submission of a capability statement. Please restrict all responses to non-proprietary information. Capable offerors are also invited to submit feedback on the nature of propane price stability, their ability to provide stable fair and reasonable price quotes, and any concerns about the use of a firm fixed price contract. Submissions should include the following information: (1) Company name, address, POC name, phone number, fax number and email address; (2) Contractor CAGE Code; (3) Business; (4) Salient characteristics of the supply offered. Submissions are not to exceed 4 pages in length. All technical questions and inquiries may be submitted with the response, and shall be prepared using Times New Roman font no larger than 12 point. A cover page containing the company?s name ,address, Cage code, DUNS, years in business, affiliate information, parent company, joint venture partners, NAICS code 336612, business size/socio-economic status, Government business point-of-contact name, phone number, and email address. All submissions are required to be submitted via email to Kenneth Brown at kenneth.b.brown24.civ@us.navy.mil no later than 4:00 PM Eastern Time on 16 May 2022. Disclaimer and Important Note. This notice does not obligate the Government to award a contact or otherwise pay for the information provided in response. The Government reserves the right to use information provided by respondents for any purpose deemed necessary and legally appropriate. Any organization responding to this notice should ensure that its response is complete and sufficiently detailed to allow the Government to determine organization?s qualifications to perform the work. Respondents are advised that the Government is under no obligation to acknowledge receipt of the information received or provide feedback to respondents with respect to any information submitted.

description: 22R0068 This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. Naval Surface Warfare Center, Indian Head Explosive Ordnance Disposal Technology Division (NSWC IHEODTD), located in Indian Head, Maryland intends to award a firm fixed price (FFP) purchase order using Simplified Acquisition Procedures for: CRRC P5.8 Boat. This solicitation will be competed as full and open. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation and a written solicitation will not be issued. Quotes are being requested under Request for Quotation (RFQ) no. N0017422R0068. The NAICS code is 336612. The provisions and clauses included and/or incorporated in this solicitation document are those in effect through the Federal Acquisition Circular. This RFQ incorporates all provisions and clauses in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular FAC 2020-01 and the Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS) DPN 20190531. The Basis for Award will be Lowest Price Technically Acceptable from this solicitation to the responsible vendor whose quote, conforming to the solicitation that will be most advantageous to the Government, given the factors considered. The Government intends to evaluate all timely quotes received from eligible vendors. The Government intends to evaluate quotations and award a contract without discussions. The Government reserves the right to conduct discussions if the Contracting Officer later determines them to be necessary. Evaluation Factors (in order of importance) 1. Technical ? Quotes must reflect the required specifications included in the RFQ- IAW 1.0 of the SOW. 2. Price ? Quotes must include all applicable costs. Questions/clarification regarding this solicitation must be submitted via email to Jodi.l.fields.civ@us.navy.mil and david.a.greaves4.civ@us.navy.mil by Friday 06 May 2022, by 04:00 PM EST. Quote packages are due by 13 May 2022 4:00 PM EST. Late quotes will not be considered. Quote packages shall INCLUDE THE COMPLETED/FILLED IN RFQ and need to be emailed to Jodi.l.fields.civ@us.navy.mil and david.a.greaves4.civ@us.navy.mil and contain a cover sheet that provides the following information: 1. Official Company Name; 2. Point of contact including name and phone number; and 3. DUNS number and Cage Code. The Points of Contact for this acquisition is 1. description:
Replacement Outboard Motors and Rigging Kits for Jefferson County Sheriff's Marine Division
Solicitation ID: IFB22-024JW
Status: Posted
Contact Name: Jamey West
Contact Number: 409-835-8793
Contact Email: jwest@co.jefferson.tx.us
Response Due Time: 11:00 AM
Response Due Date: 5/25/2022
Agency/Texas SmartBuy Member Number: C1230
Solicitation Description:
LEGAL NOTICE
Advertisement for Invitation for Bids
April 26, 2022
Notice is hereby given that sealed bids will be accepted by the Jefferson County Purchasing Department for Invitation for Bid (IFB 22-024/JW) Replacement Outboard Motors and Rigging Kits for Jefferson County Sheriffs Marine Division. Specifications for this project may be obtained from the Jefferson County Purchasing website at: https://www.co.jefferson.tx.us/Purchasing/ or by calling 409-835-8593.

Bids are to be sealed and addressed to the Purchasing Agent with the bid number and name marked on the outside of the envelope or box. Bidders shall forward an original and two (2) copies of their bid to the address shown below. Jefferson County does not accept bids submitted electronically. Late bids will be rejected as non-responsive. Bids will be publicly opened and read aloud in the Jefferson County Engineering Department Conference Room (5th Floor, Historic Courthouse) 1149 Pearl Street, Beaumont, Texas 77701, at the time and date below. Bidders are invited to attend the sealed bid opening.

BID NAME: Replacement Outboard Motors and Rigging Kits for Jefferson County Sheriffs Marine Division
BID NUMBER: IFB 22-024/JW
DUE BY TIME/DATE: 11:00 AM CT, Wednesday, May 25, 2022
MAIL OR DELIVER TO: Jefferson County Purchasing Department, 1149 Pearl Street, 1st Floor, Beaumont, Texas 77701
Any questions relating to these bid requirements should be directed to Jamey West, Contract Specialist at 409-835-8593 or via email at: jwest@co.jefferson.tx.us
Jefferson County encourages Disadvantaged Business Enterprises (DBEs) and Historically Underutilized Businesses (HUBs) to participate in the bidding process. Jefferson County does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age or disability in employment, or the provisions of services. Individuals requiring special accommodations are requested to contact our office at least seven (7) days prior to the bid due date (at 409-835-8593) to make appropriate arrangements.

Jefferson County reserves the right to accept or reject any or all proposals, to waive technicalities and to take whatever action is in the best interest of Jefferson County. All interested firms are invited to submit a bid in accordance with the terms and conditions stated in this bid.
Respondents are strongly encouraged to carefully read the entire invitation.
Deborah L. Clark, Purchasing Agent
Jefferson County, Texas

category_id: Equipment: Boat and Marine Bids
title: Custom Work Boat -Over 21 Feet
description:
Custom Work Boat -over 21 feet
Solicitation ID: E220704
Status: Posted
Contact Name: TWDB Procurement
Contact Number: 512-463-9198
Contact Email: purchasing@twdb.texas.gov
Response Due Time: 2:00 PM
Response Due Date: 5/13/2022
Agency/Texas SmartBuy Member Number: 580
Solicitation Description:
Boat should be built with the following capabilities and specifications:
-Ability to safely deploy buoys and mooring weights weighing up to 500lbs. measuring as large as 4 ft. tall x 3 ft. wide using an electronic davit crane or similar equipment in coastal and reservoir environments
-Ability to retrieve mooring weights off the seafloor and with sufficient power to pull mooring weights that have sunken into the sediment

-Customized aluminum docking mount for securing buoys on deck using davit crane to load buoys into docking mount
-Aluminum boat constructed of 3/16 aluminum
-Ability to operate in 1-2 ft. water depths
-Hydraulic jack plate with self-contained hydraulic pump system (no reservoirs) and appropriately sized to outboard
-4-stroke, Minimum 250 HP, or such HP necessary for the boat to be fully capable of conducting intended operations, while fully laden, at normal operating speeds
-Suitable outboard for proposed boat build and TWDB applications with available service & repair in the Austin area is preferred
-12 position breaker panel
-LED navigation and anchor lights
-Hydraulic steering rated such that the boats outboard horsepower coincides with the minimum operating range for the hydraulic pump
-Aluminum tandem trailer with brakes
-Power-Pole or similar anchor system
-T-Top
-Flush deck with rubber flooring
-Bow and side rails measuring 26 high with removable side rails
-Leaning post with upholstered seat and back rest and ability to securely stow away cooler under seat
-Two cranking batteries
-Stainless steel steering wheel
-Bilge pump
-Ability to mount computer display and GPS at cockpit

title: V--Boat Lifting Service for Lower Mississippi-Gulf Water Science Center
description: This is a sources sought announcement only. This source sought is for acquisition planning purposes only and shall not be construed as a commitment by the government to issue a solicitation or ultimately award a contract. Any cost incurred as a result of the announcement shall be borne by the interested party (prospective offeror) and will not be charged to the government for reimbursement. Respondents will not be notified of the results of any government assessments. Scope: The Lower Mississippi-Gulf Water Science Center (LMGWSC) needs to obtain a service to have their research boats launched/lifted into the Mississippi River near Belle Chasse, Louisiana. The boats are between 24 and 26 feet in length LA. A 24 hours? notice will be given before the service is required. This requirement is anticipated to be a multi-year contract with an estimate of 40 lifts per year. The Suggest NAICS - 713930 Marinas Requested Information: Respondents interested in performing the proposed project should submit following information: A. Offerors' name, address, points of contact with telephone numbers and e-mail addresses. B. SAM Unique Entity ID and/or CAGE code C. Are you a small business under 713930 NAICS code? D. category_id: Equipment: Boat and Marine Bids
title: Mining Expendable Delivery Unmanned Submarine Asset (MEDUSA) Request for Information
description: Date: 28 April 2022 MEDUSA Industry Day Overview: The Naval Sea Systems Command, Headquarters (NAVSEA HQ) intends to hold a virtual Industry Day on 18 to 19 May 2022 from 1000 to 1700 EDT, hosted by the Program Executive Office Unmanned and Small Combatants (PEO USC), Unmanned Maritime Systems Program Office (PMS 406), to brief the Mining Expendable Delivery Unmanned Submarine Asset (MEDUSA) opportunity.? PMS 406 is the Navy?s lead Program Office for efforts pertaining to unmanned maritime system development. The objective of this event is to provide Government information and solicit industry feedback to the proposed MEDUSA program strategy. The MEDUSA Industry Day will provide an overview of the MEDUSA program description and high-level Concept of Operations; the program schedule; the contracting, competition, and business strategies; and the program requirements and objectives. The Government will make available draft MEDUSA information, as it is ready for distribution, to approved contractors that pre-register via the attached ?MEDUSA Industry Day Registration Form?.? Additionally, companies that have not already filed a ?MEDUSA Terms of Use? form with the Government, must do so to pre-register for the Industry Day.? The Government will seek feedback on this information during the MEDUSA Industry Day. ? Industry Day Information: The Industry Day event will be held virtually.?? The Industry Day brief will be held at the UNCLASSIFIED ? (CUI) level and the information presented by the Government is considered Distribution Statement D.? See Attachment ?MEDUSA Industry Day Registration Form? to register for Industry Day. The specific details for joining the virtual Industry Day and MEDUSA Program overview presentation will be provided via separate correspondence to pre-registered and approved companies only. Pre-registration is required to participate in the MEDUSA Industry Day. Registration on the day of the event is not allowed.? Indicate on the registration form all representatives of your company that will participate in Industry Day. The Government?s presentation via Microsoft Teams virtual meeting and teleconference will begin promptly at 1000 on 18 May 2022. The Government will distribute the meeting information and teleconference number to all approved companies that pre-register via e-mail. The Government will send a calendar invite to each company?s designated representative identified on the attached registration form. For connectivity issues, each company is restricted to two (2) Teams meeting connections or call in-lines. The Meeting/teleconference number will open at 0930 on 18 May 2022 to provide participants 30 minutes to verify connectivity. Engagement Sessions: Engagement sessions will be conducted during the afternoon of 18 May 2022 and, if needed, from 0900 to 1700 on 19 May 2022. Engagement sessions will be held virtually or in-person in the Washington Navy Yard area. In-person engagement sessions may be held at the Secret level; virtual engagement sessions will be held at the Unclassified level only. ?Companies may indicate their preference for virtual or in-person on the attached registration form. Engagement sessions are meetings between the Government and individual approved companies and are intended for industry to ask questions and provide feedback to the Navy. The Government will provide the same level of information during the sessions whether the engagement session is virtual or in-person. Engagement session slots are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Indicate on the registration form if your company is interested in scheduling an engagement session. The Government will forward assigned timeslots to individual companies via separate correspondence prior to Industry Day. Companies that wish to have an in-person engagement session will be provided information on the location and security requirements separately. ?Any company that receives a virtual engagement session must provide a teleconference number to use during the session, and forward to the Government?s POCs at least 24 hours prior to the session. For planning purposes, teleconference numbers must be able to accommodate up to twenty (20) Government representatives on the line, and all participating company representatives. Companies requesting an in-person engagement session at the Secret level will be sent directions via separate correspondence to submit their visit request. Access for all Industry Day events will be restricted to U.S. DoD contractors only. Audio or visual recording devices of any kind are prohibited.? The CAGE number provided on the registration form will be used to verify U.S. DoD contractors. The deadline for registration is 11 May 2022 at 1700 EDT. ?There will be no hard-copy materials provided to industry. Industry Day slides will be digitally distributed to registered and pre-approved participants after Industry Day. In-person engagement sessions only may be held at the Secret level. No Classified information will be discussed at virtual engagement sessions. The MEDUSA Industry Day will be conducted in two parts: Part 1) Virtual presentation to all attendees by the Government. Part 2) One-on-one engagement sessions. The notional MEDUSA Industry Day schedule is as follows: Day 1- May 18 2022 1000-1200 - Part 1 - Government Presentation 1200-1300 - Lunch 1300-1700 - Part 2 - Engagement Sessions Day 2- May 19 2022 0900-1700 - Part 2 - Continued Engagement Sessions DISCLAIMER: This pre-solicitation notice is for information only, and shall not be construed as a commitment by the Government to solicit contractual offers or award contracts. Prior to release of the formal solicitation, the Government is not soliciting, nor will it accept, proposals as a result of this synopsis. The Government will not reimburse the cost of any submission in response to this announcement -- the entire cost of any submission will be at the sole expense of the source submitting the information. If a solicitation is issued in the future, it will be announced under Contract Opportunities via the System for Award Management (SAM) website (https://sam.gov/) and interested parties must comply with that announcement. The Government will not reimburse respondents for any questions submitted or information provided as a result of this notice. Date: 25 April 2022 Only one response is necessary for this announcement.??? This notice is for market research purposes only and does NOT constitute a request for proposal.? This notice shall not be construed as a contract, a promise to contract, or as a commitment of any kind by the Government.? The Government is NOT seeking or accepting unsolicited proposals. Failure to respond to this Request for Information (RFI) does not preclude participation in any future Request for Proposal (RFP), if any is issued. If an RFP is issued, it will be synopsized on https://www.beta.sam.gov.? This Sources Sought/RFI notice is issued by the Department of the Navy, Naval Sea Systems Command, Program Executive Office Unmanned and Small Combatants, Unmanned Maritime Systems Program Office (PMS 406).? PMS 406 is developing a Mining Expendable Delivery Unmanned Submarine Asset (MEDUSA) to meet future submarine delivery of payloads requirements.? MEDUSA will be a tactical clandestine mining system, with an expendable Unmanned Underwater Vehicle (UUV) capable of being torpedo tube launched from US Navy submarines. The MEDUSA system will consist of the MEDUSA medium-class UUV, supporting equipment, and payloads.?? The Navy is requesting industry?s feedback on development of the MEDUSA system in consideration of the TLRs and MEDUSA program goals within the notional schedule. Respondents should assume the following information:? Notional Schedule (notional schedule within the controlled technical data). Note that responses to this Request For Information (RFI) will influence schedule details with the exception of four (4) prototype deliveries required by Fiscal Year (FY) 2026.? FY 2023 ? Q4 ? Risk Reduction, Prototype Design, Fabrication, and Test Award? FY 2026 ? Q4 ? Delivery of 4 Prototype Units? Require compliance to 10 U.S.C. Section 7309, which prohibits construction of major component of the hull or superstructure of the MEDUSA in a foreign facility.? MEDUSA UUV shall conform to the Unmanned Maritime Autonomy Architecture (UMAA).?? The Contractor is responsible for meeting the interface requirements for the payloads, provided as part of the RFP (when released), and will be provided surrogate payloads as Government Furnished Property for testing.?? The complete RFI posting contains controlled technical data that cannot be posted to Government Point of Entry and will only be made available to U.S. Department of Defense contractors cleared for Distribution D (DoD and DoD Contractors only).? For those interested, contact the NAVSEA Contracting Officer listed below for a Distribution D (DoD and DoD Contractors only) set of questions and additional information.?? Primary Point of Contact:? Eric Dieges, NAVSEA Contracting Officer,?eric.dieges.civ@us.navy.mil? Secondary Point of Contact:? Cristina Vega,?NAVSEA Contract Specialist,??cristina.a.vega5.civ@us.navy.mil? Respondents should provide the following information:? Companies must request access and provide the information under Block 6 of a DD Form 254 (APR 2018) via electronic mail to POCs above.? This information shall included the following or the company will be deemed nonresponsive:? A completed Terms of Use form Company name, address, and ZIP code? Company CAGE code? Cognizant Defense Security Service (DSS) Security Office name, address, and ZIP code? Business Website? Two Points of Contact with Name, Title, Phone Number, Email Address
